With the help of technology, we ease the administrative burden that preschools experiencs around the statutory systematic quality work. We also concretize the preschool assignment for parents who want to understand and participate in their child's development. In the longer term, Fokus Förskola is also a way to export the model, and the knowledge, about Swedish preschool to other countries. We have based the tool on a child's so called learning processes, which are alike no matter where in the world the child lives. The Why We run pre-schools in Stockholm since 2012, under the name Hoppetossa. We started working with Hoppetossa preschools three years ago, to concretized the curriculum area digital competence. In August this year, the tool Fokus Förskola was launched within Hoppetossa and we have further developed the tool together with preschool educators. We have also presented the tool to a municipality in the Stockholm area as well as to an industry organization for independent preschools, and both have expressed an interest.

The Pitch Fair-Green.com is a B2B e-commerce platform focusing on eco-friendly promotional products and giveaways to allow companies to make an environmentally conscious choice to advertise their brand. The What Fair Green is promoting RESPONSIBLE PRODUCTION of promotional products by selecting items either made from recycled materials (recycle tires, pallets, plastic bottles, CD cases, etc.) or sustainably sourced plant fibers (jute, sugar cane, timber, bamboo, etc.). Thus, putting pressure on the production of these items for more environmentally sound solutions. Fair Green is also promoting RESPONSIBLE CONSUMPTION of promotional products by allowing companies to have an environmentally conscious alternative to traditional promotional products which are, traditionally, made on the other side of the planet from virgin plastic. The How Our solution is based on a SHORT SUPPLY CHAIN (all of suppliers are located in Europe); TRANSPARENCY (we showcase not only where the products are manufactured but also from what materials); and CONVENIENCE (traditionally to order promotional products you have to pick up the phone or ask for a quote, there is no way to order directly online, we want to change that outdated practice by allowing our customers to both order and customise their products online). The Why Fair Green stems from the will to challenge the current promotional product industry and offer to companies a way to advertise their brand in an environmentally conscious way. Ultimately, we want to challenge the status quo regarding promotional products and put environmental sustainability forward to make organisations greener.

The Pitch We want to change the way speakers are produced. At Aarhus Soundsystem we strive to develop the most sustainable speakers in the world - without compromising on sound quality. The What Almost 9 out of 10 Danes regard global climate change as a serious one problem, and the proportion who are concerned that climate change will exist injury to themselves during their lifetime has increased from 30 percent in 2015 to 41 percent this year. (Concito Climate Barometer 2018) Our interest in speakers has given us an insight into the speaker industry, this is why we know that, very polluting production methods and materials are still in use. The How That is why we are a company that considers sustainability, recycling and climate friendly production into every aspect of our business. Our circulation principle ensures minimal pollution throughout the product life cycle. So far we have succeeded in replacing traditional wood with bamboo. We are working also keen on developing and finding sustainable materials and production methods for the remaining parts. We expect in the long term to be 100% CO2 neutral Among other things, by planting of Bamboo fields in developing countries. The Why The idea for sustainable speakers came up after the Co-founders Lasse and Troels saw a TED-talk where Bamboo was used as a sustainable building material in Bali. We could combine this back then with our knowledge back from having built speakers for festivals. Over the time, the idea was matured through various conversations with engineers, entrepreneurs and business people.

The Pitch Kanpla is developing a digital platform to help canteens reduce food waste by taking orders. The What Food waste is an enormous sustainability issue. Denmark alone wastes 700,000 tons of food each year. At Kanpla, we care about food waste in school canteens. Without knowing how many people will eat a given meal, canteens have to prepare more food than necessary. Canteens are wasting dozens of kilograms of food every day, and studies show that there is a potential for improvement. Pursuing the goal of Responsible Consumption and Production (UN Goals), we want to reduce food waste in canteens as much as possible. The How Kanpla is a digital platform for ordering canteen food. Through our web application, parents can create a meal plan for their kids in advance. No need to give children money for lunch, the food is already paid for online. Canteens know exactly how many orders there are, so they know exactly how much to cook. They can afford to offer a wide variety of dishes while reducing leftovers, and thus food waste. The Why As students, we had the problem of food waste in canteens right in front of our eyes. Realizing how big the problem actually is, we discovered an enormous business opportunity. The market consists of outdated solutions if any, and it's here for us to disrupt it. We want to provide an excellent product that makes reducing food waste effortless.

The Pitch Air0 has developed a care-free total solution for clean indoor air - Clean Air as a Service. It's a fully programmable & automated clean air system scaling up to any needs. CAaaS model includes indoor air quality monitoring, high-end air purifiers, central management via cloud and expert analysis. The What We can survive 30 days without food - for developed countries, one can always choose not to eat rotten food. We can survive 3 days without water - for us, bottled water is available option for places, where the tap water is not clean. But we can only survive 3 minutes without air. We are forced to breathe the air, no matter how polluted it is. According to WHO, each year millions of people die as a result of being exposed to bad air quality. The ultra fine particles generated by traffic and burning, are so small, they can penetrate to our blood stream via our lungs. Air pollution will then affect to our health causing lung cancer and other lung diseases, heart attacks and stroke, as well as other, less severe health issues, such as headache, nausea, fatigue and flu. For our market, there are two big issues causing polluted indoor air; very polluted outdoor air, which leaks indoors effectively (e.g. in China) and sick building syndrome (e.g. in Finland). The How The core of our solution is the unique and patented smAIRt® technology. It combines the best of the traditional air purification technologies, mechanical and electrical filtration, to achieve maximal amounts of clean air. For air purification, it is the most important factor. Since perfecting the purification technology and creating two beautiful stand-alone products out of it, we have also taken a step further, to provide our customers the best possible service, in a simple and easy way from set-up to usage. We call it Clean Air as a Service. CAaaS was launched in 2019, and it is a fully scalable, full-service concept for delivering clean air. Our CAaaS model is an IoT solution, enabling real-time follow up for air quality in all the different rooms and properties at a glance. Air purification is fully automated, fully programmable and centrally managed for all the rooms. Expert reports and analysis are available, maintenance and support is included in the service fee. The Why The idea for Air0 came from one of our co-founders, Mr. Rajala. He has decades of experience with aerosol physics and fine-particles, and just before Air0, he was involved in the indoor air industry in the Asian market. While spending time there, it became obvious that there was a serious air quality problem and people were desperately searching for a solution. They needed air purifier that was capable of producing large amounts of pure air, while being silent, energy efficient and requiring little maintenance. They needed a new innovation for the air purification. And that was the challenge Mr. Rajala was ready to face. From day 0, Air0 has been eyeing to China market and today we already have a distributor in China. Other team members have various reasons that drive them every day; passion for hi-tech and cleantech development, some have personal background with indoor air quality issues and others are just keen to provide cleaner air for people.

The Pitch We want to make the best wild cider in the world on 100 % Danish apples and prove that cider can be every bit as quenchy and informal as beer, as complex as wine, as sour as lambic, and as fruitful as freshly squeezed juice. The What Every year, in the private gardens of Denmark, 5 million kilos of apples fall from trees and are abandoned. On the island of Fyn (Funen, eng) there is a long-standing tradition of handing in surplus fruit to the cidery in Ørbæk where apple donors sign a paper stating that no pesticides have been used. This is ecology and old school reduction of food waste without a label. This year we have filled some of our fermentation tanks with juice from these crispy garden apples of Fyn. We also use selected varieties from Lilleø for our small-batch cuvées. At Decideret Cider we do cider workshops and DIY-courses as well with the sustainable initiative GroSelv and Meyers Madhus – because real cider is in fact something everyone in possession of good apples can make. We are also one of the initiators and organizers behind Rigtig Cider - Copenhagen Cider Festival. The How In Denmark we are blessed with apples that balances a tart acidity with a fruitful apple sweetness. Our cider culture is on the other hand depleted. Our food culture has been elevated with the new nordic kitchen - now it is time to take a look at what we drink. We crush and press apples, ferment juice into cider, and bottle it by hand in small and big bottles - cider can be kept well in both a wine cellar and in a breast pocket. Some ciders are to be drunk young and fresh with a full throttle apple flavour. Other ciders gain flavour when aged in oak. For all our ciders we can say that they are wild fermented and they are made solely from Danish apples with a focus on craftsmanship, curiosity and reducing food waste. In Copenhagen we distribute all our ciders ourselves on an electric cargo bike with a trailer. The Why It all started in the late summer of 2015 in Nørrebroparken in Copenhagen. We were five old friends wondering why we in Denmark don’t have a culture for drinking good cider. France, England and Spain all have their own proud traditions and vinification techniques. In august that year we borrowed a press and went straight at it. We gathered apples from the gardens and parks of Copenhagen and ended up with a small production; we filled some 100 bottles in a garage next to Utterslev Mose in the northwestern part of Copenhagen. The following year we moved “the production” into a container under Bispeengbuen in Nørrebro/Frederiksberg where we made some highly explosive cider. Next stop was Grønttorvet (the old vegetable market of Copenhagen) where we produced around 3000 L of highly drinkable cider. We delivered the cider on our bikes to bars, special kiosks and restaurants around Copenhagen and when the summer of 2018 ended - we had been on sale for 5 months - we were sold out.

The Pitch Active outdoor e-sports for teams. Social and healthy with your friends. The What People of all ages excercise too little. This is partly due to the inactive nature of digital gaming and entertainment. The abundance of digital entertainment with no physical excercise has exploded. The affected population is mostly children. With GoPlayDOT you use digital gaming running outside with a team. The How GoPlayDOT give you social interaction, fresh air and lost of high impact excercise. 30.000 players have downloaded the app. The games is played every day across schools in Denmark and some in Norway. The game is simple and easy to understand yet compelling and fun. It can be played by anyone holidng a GPS- and data-enabled smartphone. Children as young as 7 have proved to learn the game very fast. Adults can easily play too. The Why Fixing the issues about social interaction, physical excercise and fresh air created by individual indoor computer gaming, whil still utilizing the enormous power and potential of digital technologies. Turing any park or sports field into a digital playing field is cost efficielnt and uses not space.

The Pitch Diabezy wants to help diabetics of the world with an everyday life made easier. The What The number of people diagnosed with diabetes in the world is around 415 million. Diabetes is considered as the 21st century epidemic. In Australia alone 180 people are diagnosed with diabetes each day. It’s not just effecting the people who have diabetes but also the family around that person and of course a huge global cost. Diabetics who do not manage their diabetes can develop complications, such as kidney issues, foot amputations, eyesight problems, depression etc., later in life. Our goal works in celloration with SDG goal 3.4, where we want help improve QoL and prevent premature diabetes caused death by proactive treatment and support, and improve mental health and well-being of diabetics. The How By providing a platform that offers a number of functions to assist the diabetic in his or hers daily routines in order to help their QoL and mental attitude. The app has a coaching approach with a tracker that helps you track your habits and learn from your experience. A community to learn from other diabetics, and a database with fundamental information on diabetes. We also provide a 24/7 support for diabetics in the way of a lifestyle coach, a diabetes mentor, a nurse, and personal trainer, for users who want to take it to the next level and have a team of professionals in their pocket at all times. Our focus is not on the specific type of diabetes but a holistic approach towards the person behind diabetes, which also includes their family. The Why We have always enjoyed working to help people in our past and current projects. That is part of our “why” and so when the idea for this came, it was a no-brainer. Our co-founder is a Type 1 Diabetic himself and has been through quite the journey because of it. Many of the ideas and functionality in the app, came from Martin’s own experience, and ways to overcome his struggles with diabetes in the past. We want to inspire, guide, help, and support as many diabetics as we can, through Diabezy.

The Pitch Radiobotics is challenging the status quo of musculoskeletal radiology, increasing throughput by automating routine tasks, whilst improving diagnostic quality. The What At Radiobotics, we are novel health technology with an aim to improve quality and time use at hospitals, helping both clinicians and patients. We are focusing on creating machine learning driven algorithms, that aid radiologists in interpreting and reporting on routine images at hospitals. We are looking for a new talented colleague, that can help us performing trials with hospitals, whilst administering data and all processes related hereto. The How Radiobotics is a Danish health startup, creating algorithms for radiology departments, aiding radiologists and radiographers interpreting musculoskeletal (msk) x-rays, with a focus on improving efficiency and diagnostic quality. Our technology answers the question of how to minimize the built-up imagining workloads due to the startling low number of radiologists around the world. There are currently many vacant radiology positions globally and this technology is there to lessen the load on existing radiologists and to make sure that patients are getting the screenings they need, thoroughly double checked . The Why Radiobotics, founded in 2017 and led by CEO Mads Jarner Brevadt, is aiming to save healthcare professionals time by automating medical imaging diagnosis with artificial intelligence, and ultimately improve the life of millions of patients worldwide. The idea was conceived by Mads Jarner and Martin Axelsen, both co-founders, who had been studying together at the Technical University of Denmark.

The Pitch We have developed a technology for identity safety and real-time threat intelligence. The What We believe individuals and companies are entitled to their own data. We make sure your personal data stays yours. The value of our services is created in cooperation with our partners and customers. Our goal is to create the world's most sophisticated platform for innovation in digital security and privacy. As with the help of large data acquisition, AI and machine learning, we want to solve the biggest challenges with security and integrity. The How We give our customers real-time relevant insights. Real-time threat intelligence is a vital component of any truly proactive security strategy. Defentry is a trust-tech business with a vision to create a safer everyday life for everyone. In a world where cyber-crimes and identity thefts are multiplying, we provide simple and innovative services to protect everyone’s digital identity and integrity. The Why Defentry is a cyber security company active on a global market, founded in 2015, in Stockholm, Sweden - the tech capital of Europe. We have developed a technology for identity safety and real-time threat intelligence. With the help of AI, our platform scans governmental, open-web, deep-web and dark-web sources to alert you if your personal information is changed or leaked. This will help you minimize the risk of potential ID-thefts and corporate breaches.

The Pitch Microwise has develope a test kit for automatic detection of live organisms in ballast water, Ballastwise, which will help the shipping industry staying compliant with the new IMO ballat water regulations. The What Shipping has been identified as a major pathway for introducing invasive species to new environments. The effects of the introduction of new species have in many areas of the world been devastating. In order to prevent the spread of harmful aquatic organisms from one region to another the Ballast Water Management Convention has been adopted by the The International Maritime Organization (IMO) and the US Coast Guard. Under the Convention, all ships in international traffic are required to clean their ballast water to a certain standard. A number of approved ballast water management systems are available on the market, however, there are no approved systems for which can automatically test water quality according to the IMO and USCG ballast water standards. The How BallastWISE represents a new method for quantifying microbial life in relation to existing instruments used for testing ballast water. Manual microscopy using motility and fluorescence is still the benchmark against which automated systems are tested, and in many ways, BallastWISE is an automation of that procedure using software, cameras and optical assemblies. Currently, the only excepted compliance test must be performed in the laboratory and is often based on manual microscopy, which is time consuming and expensive. It is our ambition to make BallastWISE the first portable test kit which will go a long way towards a true compliance test in the field. The Why We heard about the Ballast water convention back in 2013, before it was adopted by the IMO. At that time the market for Ballast Water Management Systems (BWMS) was developing, but there was very little interest in test-systems for ballast water quality. However, we were sure that test tools eventually would be needed. We had worked with image analysis based tools and camera-technology for analysis of micro-organisms for many years, and had software tools that we found suitable for automatic testing of live organisms in water samples. We applied for funding from several Danish funds, who supported the development of Ballastwise, which was much more challenging than we initially thought it would be. The Ballastwise system is now fully functional, and is being tested by several external laboratories.

The Pitch Rel8 aims to revolutionize traceability for mass produced plastic products The What Plastic pollution can afflict land, waterways and oceans. It is estimated that 1.1 to 8.8 million metric tons (MT) of plastic waste enters the ocean from coastal communities each year. Living organisms, particularly marine animals, can be harmed either by mechanical effects, such as entanglement in plastic objects, problems related to ingestion of plastic waste, or through exposure to chemicals within plastics that interfere with their physiology. Effects on humans include disruption of various hormonal mechanisms. The How rel8 develops zero-impact traceability technology for plastics production. We focus on manipulation of surface textures in the molding step, thereby avoiding unnecessary process steps and materials. How? — Marking during molding cycle — Microstructured markings — No ink, label or pigments — No machinery or equipment — Scans with Vision and smartphone — Only method to work on black plastic The Why In 2005, Guggi Kofod )CEO) led a research group into new nano-composite materials for applications as "artificial muscles". We investigated electrical, mechanical and dielectric properties of novel composite materials incorporating nano-meter-sized fillers, as well as many applications of these devices. He progressed to engage with a company called Inmold, active in development of micro- and nanostructuring technologies for injection moulding and roll-to-roll film making, with several new high-tech products and spin-offs (Heliac.dk and Rel8.dk).

The Pitch Healper is an online booking platform that matches people with mental health disorders such as depression, anxiety and addiction with the right psychologist that fits their needs. The What In Denmark, mental disorders account for 25% of the disease burden and cost society 55 billion DKK annually with more than 2,000 people receiving therapy from a psychologist every day. Further, too many individuals do not receive timely help as they cannot cope with the draining 5-hour process it takes to find and book a psychologist. At the same time, U.S. experience shows that only 20-40% of people find a psychologist they trust and have ´chemistry´ with. This is tragic, as just one bad experience can cause a client to completely drop out of or postpone his/her therapy. The ineffective booking process and the risk of a poor patient-therapist match mean that many people continue to struggle with mental illness who could otherwise be treated. This has major consequences for individuals whose mental illness markedly impairs their quality of life, but also largely affect their family and friends. Furthermore, this is a major problem for society. The How The cornerstone of Healper is an optimal match between each client and psychologist combined with a personal tailormade user journey. The most important factor in the match is optimizing the likelihood of a strong therapeutic alliance between the psychologist and the client. The best condition for this therapeutic alliance appears when the psychologist reminds the client of someone, he/she naturally trusts. Therefore, we determine matches based on the psychologist’s experience, geography, style, and demography. We have set up an operational analysis algorithm with variable constraints that mathematically assess the matching parameters and can choose which psychologists best match each client. In the U.S., we have found that these parameters can improve the match rate by approximately 350%. Healper’s team has extensive experience in advanced mathematical models and AI, and are using a culturally adapted version of the U.S. algorithm. The Why Three years ago, when one of the founders was studying in the United States, he developed with two friends a diary app that uses artiﬁcial intelligence to improve the mental health of psychologists’ clients. He, however, he realized that the psychology market was not ready for the technology and found there were lower hanging fruits with greater value in facilitating the relationship between psychologists and clients, so he began to research the market and build the team.

The Pitch Rebox: a startup applying circular economy to moving boxes The What Our current economy is linear and based on a take-make-dispose approach that has proven itself to be highly unsustainable. We want to bring circularity into one important aspect of human life: moving in and out. Moving requires many boxes that will be only used once although their lifetime is much greater than that. Rebox has created a logistics system that allows for each box to be used to its fullest capacity, safely. The How The company's idea is to reuse moving boxes through three channels. The first is home by picking up moving boxes from customers' home, the second by collecting used boxes from stores, and the third is to wholesale boxes to moving companies as many of them, especially the smaller ones, cannot afford to stock moving boxes. Delivery and future pick-up of the boxes are both included in the price. For every ten boxes that are collected, Rebox commits to plant one tree via the "Vi forest". Reactions from customers are very positive, they do not have to handle the boxes themselves. So far, 40,000 moving boxes have been saved. The Why Fredrik got the idea for the company in connection with his job at the time in shipping and container freight, and his and a friend's move. He did not want to throw away his moving boxes, so his friend came and picked them up for himself. According to Fredrik, shipping and Rebox's idea is really the same business model, so in 2014 he started testing the idea as a hobby, and then started the company in 2015.

The Pitch Making the world more sustainable through greatly designed bags and accessories by setting a higher standard, not only to every detail in our production but to the industry as a whole. The What Traversing from East to West and experiencing industrial pollution to mass consumption, we came to an idea to reduce the environmental footprint. This through careful selection of products for the global market, starting with the bag industry. We often overlook how a product is manufactured and what kind of materials are used in our day-to-day consumption. However, our choice of purchase has huge impacts both on the environment and human health. Since the consequences of this careless consumption are more evident now than ever, it is time to scrutinize our behavior and take our responsibility towards the people and the planet. The How Because of our strong environmental focus, it’s natural to choose the absolute best environmentally friendly materials that exist on earth. Therefore, The Poli is offering bags, made of the most sustainable natural fiber jute and ecological cow leathers. High environmental standards not only depends on the materials used, it also calls for the importance of several production aspects. We want to go further than the sustainable resource use by combining a regenerative design concept together with ethical business and leadership from our manufacturing to business offer. The Why As The Poli is here to lead the way and be an example to the rest of the world our journey will never end. We will always strive to do things better by keep thinking outside the box. Our ‘zero waste policy’ is implemented in the production plan through converting wastage of materials into usable resources. Through our continuous production improvements efforts we also strive to reduce waste as well as resources such as water and energy consumption in the production process. We also hope to be able to use recycled water and renewable sources for energy in our future production plan, in order to reduce environmental impacts further.

The Pitch MeetinVR is developing a VR software to help innovative organizations / remote teams to cut travelling costs with virtual reality meeting and collaboration rooms. The What Climate action. Most means of transportation have a certain ecological footprint. As carbon emissions have a direct effect on global warning and travelling is getting very popular for both leisure and business we saw an opportunity to develop a solution which will allow enterprises to meet without leaving their offices. The How We encourage companies to travel less and work in virtual reality instead. In the period of 3,5 years, we have talked with more than 500 business entities and figured out their needs in terms of meeting spaces. Consequently, we have developed 8 different environments in Virtual Reality allowing them to do collaborative work in VR. The Why 5 years ago most of the VR applications were in gaming and enttertainment sector. We saw the untapped potential in enterprise solutions and started conceptualizing a solution which will not only be beneficial from the business perspective but would also have a positive effect on society and climate change.

The Pitch Goodtalks is a professional digital network for woman. The platform supports woman in building a strong network they can draw upon to advance their career. Our goal is gender equality in leadership roles and management boards – to the benefit of the individual, corporations and society at large. The What SDG 5: gender equality Despite the fact that it’s recognised more women in top management has a positive impact on the bottom line, gender equality in Danish leadership roles and management boards leaves a lot to be desired. With 27% of woman in leadership positions Denmark is the lowest ranking of the Nordic countries and even below the OECD average of 31%.1 When it comes to corporate and board management numbers are even lower. In 2018 the proportion of women in top management was 13% and board management 17% , and the trend is decreasing. For instance only one of the C25 listed companies has a female CEO. One challenge is that candidates to fill top leadership positions are recruited via network and since these are male ‘heavy’ it creates a vicious circle that takes effort to interrupt.1 Goodtalks address the network issue that prevent women from landing top management positions by offering a platform where woman can build strong alliances and get support to grow their career. The How Goodtalks offer professional women a digital platform that allows them to build and strengthen their network across roles, functions and businesses. It works as an exchange of experiences and knowledge, which given the digital format removes barriers by making help, sparring and sharing easily available. In addition the setup encourages honest exchange of both good and challenging experiences, which serve to fuel our members with needed competencies and courage to advance their career. Further members are regularly offered the opportunity to meet in person at live events where they network and listen to two inspiring speakers (e.g. CEO’s and politicians) who share the unglossy version of their career stories. The Why Spending many years in Corporate World, Pernille who established Goodtalks, would at times find herself in organisations that had a deep negative impact on her mood and wellbeing. So much so that she would bring the tension home and take it out on her family. Searching for an explanation (and solution) a pattern emerged. Business where she had struggled to thrive all had a lack of female competencies in leadership roles and management boards in common. An imbalance that affected the entire organisation. A deep desire to facilitate balanced organisation via gender equality and change this dynamic took root. Pernille identified community as a key leaver to achieve this. An environment where women can meet up online and offline to share experiences and support each others growth. She also recognised that in order for the sharing to be relatable and have a transformational impact it had to be honest and ‘unglossy’. Soon after Goodtalks was launched.

The Pitch Stormie Poodle makes new clothes for children out of discarded high-quality hotel textiles that are kind to kids' sensitive skin. The What New clothes for kids are full of chemicals that may be irritating or harmful. By making new clothes out of used high quality textiles that have been washed many times we can limit the chemical load put on kids. At the same time we are saving water, energy and chemicals as cotton is the thirstiest crop to grow. We must become better at working towards a circular economy and this is my contribution to it. The How At Stormie Poodle we strive to make the most out of human and material resources. We make awesome products for both young and old. Our products tell a great story. All our products are made out of reused high quality hotel textiles. We employ small, ethical manufacturers in Sweden and Latvia. Livslust is a Swedish foundation that supports Latvian youths with scholarships enabling higher education. Sigtuna Hantverkshus is a social enterprise that employs people who stand far from the regular job market. The Why Why do we do what we do? Because we're passionate about nature and the wellbeing of people. Our goal is to run a profitable business by creating people and planet friendly products that look and feel great. We want to question how you look at the world and contribute to making people more aware of how everything is connected.

The Pitch We bring you zero waste coffee ♻️ Customized for your office 👌 From beans to machines ☕️ The What We believe the future of coffee is Zero Waste, which is why we are committed to reducing CO2 in every part of the ecosystem that surrounds your daily cup of coffee. From working with farmers on organic farming methods. To reducing the carbon footprint with bike delivery and local roasting. Through to reimagining packaging and eliminating plastic and aluminium bags, replacing with zero waste boxes. The How → Create Coffee Answer a few easy questions about your coffee preferences. You design and name the roast. → Let’s Taste Taste your way to the perfect coffee for your company. Exclusively made by some of the best roasters in Scandinavia. → Zero Waste Coffee Bike delivery weekly. Delivered without plastic and aluminium bags. We even recycle the coffee grounds. The Why We value free choice of taste and we aspire to have the best quality for whatever choices you make. This is why we work with the leading roasters in Scandinavia and the United Kingdom, and are our proud to call them roasters-in-residence. Together we share a passion for coffee and the uniqueness of every bean.

The Pitch Creating a world without Fraud and Money Laundering The What We are solving a fundamental trust issue between a supplier, and a customer. With all the cases of and the significant increase in bankruptcies, bad payers, fraud and all of the money laundering scandals, it has become a real problem not knowing whether or not to trust one another when doing business, especially for startups. All rating agencies are focus on enterprise solutions and the big-money, but the one has the most to potentially lose is Startups. They lack the financial capacity to withstand losses from a costumer going bankrupt and them taking a loss. Thats why we offer our services at a significant discount for all startups. Good Creditinformation should be for everybody. The How Using our experience with investigating financial crime and combining it with multiple structured and unstructured datasources we new patterns emerge. This allows us to generate the next level of machine learning algorithms that predict those patterns with real time data. Now we predict 65% of all bankruptcies minimum 3 month prior to the bankruptcies and 90% of our QA-fraud cases prior to credit being obtained. The Why We lost money ourselves due to bankruptcies and fraud. We tried to go to the big rating agencies, saw the price-level and was dismissed. We also saw the various money laundering scandals and wanted to do something about that. Small business should not worry about getting paid, but rather focus on selling and growing.

The Pitch Reach has developed a 100% online physiotherapy app to help MSK pain sufferers (the #1 cause of disability globally) access quality and evidence based care and build up the active habits that are shown to most effectively treat and prevent pain. The What Pain management and prevention should be centred around a multidimensional approach - focusing on physical activity and exercise but also on building understanding of pain and the confidence in one's ability to deal with pain. Frustratingly, MSK pain is a global epidemic, and a lot of the current treatment is part of the problem, not the solution: 1. Still, too many health practitioners promote passive treatment approaches and passive coping strategies. 2. For most, the active approach that best treats pain requires active habits to be formed, which includes both belief and behaviour change. Sadly, no one offers this high-quality care in a way that supports habit change. At Reach, we build up people’s ability and confidence to self-manage, so they do not become dependent on health professionals. In everything we do, we strive to make recovery and prevention more reassuring, accessible and motivating. The How Currently patients complete a 8 minute online assessment and receive a personalised video exercise program, we then motivate and evolve their program to recovery. During your time with Reach, we’ll work with you to develop the confidence you need to stay active at your own pace, in a way that suits your lifestyle. We’ll also support you with ongoing educational material to make sure you fully understand what’s going on ‘under the bonnet’ of your pain. You’ll get access to new educational material at checkpoints throughout your road to recovery so that you can make informed choices about how best to deal with your symptoms and keep progressing. The Why This is where it all started, and what drives everyone at Reach, everyday. - We really believe in all the benefits of being active - social, stress relief, increased energy, better health and more. - And we admire all those trying their hardest to make themselves and their lives better - and I genuinely believe most people are trying their hardest in life (shout out to Brene Brown’s book on Shame and her ted talks for this learning). - There are loads of great tools and people helping you to be active and stay active, but when things go wrong and you’re held back by pain and injury, the available choices are all so frustratingly inconvenient, slow and boring. - SO, we are ‘empowering people when their active best is under threat’. And we hope that by helping people become stronger and move forward, we can help make their lives that much better, in-turn increasing their capacity to make the lives of those around them better, and bit by bit we’ll make the world that bit better.

The Pitch Equipment whenever you need, wherever you are. The What Tooler was founded in June 2016 with the intention to bring an alternative to the high consumption we have in the community, and create an experience for rent that is so good that you don't think about buying anymore. We follow three principles to make a difference for your wallet, the future of society and the environment: 1. Reduce consumption and make better use of resources 2. Reward quality and make sharing easy and cost effective 3. Allow more people to access equipment to limit social differences The How We work both as final service provider and as SaaS provider - think of us like an Amazon for renting, making it easy for companies to offer their existing rental services or build entirely new rental and sharing services that are super convenient for the customer. We offer different kinds of membership allowing you to receive a discount on quality and professional equipment from day one so you can do more activities or use the equipment over several days. The Why Tooler is building a completely new business model - a convenient platform that companies can build new business on related to renting and sharing resources. We aim to develop a service so user friendly that it outcompetes a purchase decision for the end customer. This way we contribute to reducing today’s overconsumption and improve the growing sharing and circular economy. We are already mentioned as “the future of kiosks” in Dagens Næringsliv because of our partnership with 7-Eleven. We have launched our business mode, are already operating the tools segment with tooler.no and are working with partners to expand into new sector such as sports and clothing sector.

The Pitch We combine energy efficiency, uninterrupted power and solar power generation The What The intelligent Dynamic Power System uses solar panels with diesel or gas generators to dramatically reduce the use of fossil fuels and to provide clients with comfort and the reliability of the power supply. The heart of our solution is the Dynamic Power System. It balances unsymmetrical loads, filters harmonic currents, compensates reactive power, and supplies high current peaks on demand. This greatly improves the generator efficiency by reducing the losses and preventing overheating. Our solution replaces diesel with solar energy and gives you savings every day. The How The Dynamic Power System provides excellent reliability, balancing unsymmetrical loads, filters harmonic currents, compensates reactive power, and supplies high current peaks on demand. The energy surplus can be stored in the batteries or sold to the power utility. In case of power failure in the grid, the Dynamic Power System immediately isolates our client’s system from the grid and continues an uninterrupted power supply to our client. The change of power supply from the grid to the energy storage is undetectable to the client and they continue enjoying uninterrupted power. When the generators are used as a back-up, the Dynamic Power System supplies power from solar panels and/or from the energy storage during the downtime of the generators. The Why Our business and motivation is based on our willingness to offer solutions combining three areas of sustainability; ecological, economical and technical. We realise that practically the only way to make ecologically sustainable solutions widely popular is to make them economically viable for our clients. We are happy to offer solutions where economic feasibility can be well analysed before the investment decision. Thanks to our engineering skills and Finnish hi-tech products, Cleaner Future has created a solution to combine ecological and economic benefits in a technically sustainable way.

The Pitch NurseBuddy helps SMB home healthcare companies to provide high quality, outcome-based home care. The What The main problem we are solving is the increasing health care costs due to aging population. With high quality home care costs can be kept reasonable and older people happier in their own homes. The problem affects firstly the home care recipients who are vulnerable people. Secondly current situation creates a lot of stress to home care professionals who are trying to provide high quality care but with poor coordination. Thirdly, this affects the societies with cost pressure and the feeling that we can't take care of this generation of older people. The How We have a care coordination software for the home care managers in the office and a mobile app for the care workers in the field. Family members and other stakeholders are also welcome to collaborate for better care. Care coordination software helps the manager to build a good long-term care plan and plan weekly activities based on each individual's long term targets. It helps to find the most suitable care workers for each home visit in an efficient way, ensuring good continuity of care. Mobile app for care workers ensures that they have all the vital information with them when going to meet a person in need of support. They can feel much more confident and do their work better with no stress. Family members can also share their observations and worries - even if they are not professionals, they typically know the person from many decades and might notice changes that professionals don't. The Why We have family and friends working in different roles in home care and we heard from them how poor the existing systems are. We felt that a good solution should really help the staff to do their work better and give them peace of mind. Doing several home care visits with our pilot customers boosted our motivation to solve this complex problem.

The Pitch iSmart focuses on improving reading comprehension of heavy texts on digital devices for students, workers and also for those with learning difficulties (dyslexia, ADHD and others). We make eBooks more inclusive, increase productivity and lessen frustration. The What Education for all is our mantra, and with iSmart we help everyone to learn better by understanding more. We unleash the knowledge hidden behind the texts that many of us are overloaded with on a day to day basis. We already piloted in 4 countries and thanks to a research study we can prove that people felt more confident reading after using iSmart for a few months. The How We have our own patentable methodology that was developed together with psychologists, educationalists and experts in technology and we have ported this to an app that users can have on their mobiles or tablets. We combine various functionalities that allow users to personalise what they read and how they read it, and we also allow them to build a visual representation of what they are reading that helps the 65% of the population that are visual learners. Text to speech and speech to text technology is also available in our app and this can be slowed or speeded up by the user to find the optimum comprehension for them. The Why We had a past colleague whose son was severely dyslexic and ended up dropping out of school. This let us to start the search for a better way to learn and with collaborations with different experts and researchers we built the first basis of iSmart that we then tested out in Sweden, Turkey and the Czech Republic. The feedback was so positive from both students, teachers and parents that we decided to incorporate as a business and take the solution forward in order to help more people. Our video is found at https://vimeo.com/193022950

The Pitch Tribe Takeaway changes the world, meal by meal, as users order a meal to share a meal with a starving child, in a social takeaway experience enabling restaurants to receive orders from social media. The What Every 10 seconds a child dies from starvation. Tribe Takeaway is disrupting the takeaway industry and supporting United Nations Zero Hunger goal. Even though humans produce enough food to feed the entire planet, 821 million people still goes to bed on an empty stomach, 16 million children risk dying from starvation and right now 3 million children die from starvation on a yearly basis. The How The good news is that hunger is the world’s greatest solvable problem. Tribe Takeaway believes in connecting people and the power of sharing and that is why the core concept is "Order a meal to share a meal". By ordering through Tribe Takeaway a child automatically receives a nutritious meal. The Why Do more, do right, do impact. Humans are a social species and have through history depended a lot on cooperation and solidarity. Hormones drives our urge for social connection. Across all cultures, humans have connected with each other in two very powerful yet simple ways. By forming communities and by sharing food. Today, the biggest communities are social media, connecting people and bringing the world closer together. Sharing food is an universal language for love and has been a key to our species evolution. Tribe Takeaway works to tie all that together in one powerful social takeaway experience. To do more, to do right, to do impact, Tribe Takeaway's purpose is to help end world hunger by bringing the world closer together, as one tribe, saving children meal by meal. Tribe Takeaway - the social takeaway experience - takeaway with impact.

The Pitch Miiskin is an app and a platform assisting people with identifying changes on their skin by using images taken with their smartphone over time. A change on the skin can be an early warning sign of Melanoma skin cancer. The What 1 in 3 cancers diagnosed is skin cancer and it's estimated that over 250 million people is in the high risk of developing or dying of Melanoma - the most dangerous form of skin cancer. 1 in 5 people in the USA will develop skin cancer during their life and in Australia, it is 2 out of 3 people that will develop skin cancer. 98,3% survive melanoma and is cured if it is caught early and the single most important thing you can do actively, is to keep an eye on your skin and look for changes - either a new mark forming on your skin or as a change in an existing mole. +70% of all melanoma incidents form as a new mark on your skin and does not develop from an existing mole. Doctors are generally very good at diagnosing and assessing skin cancer, but can often not support the patient with identifying changes on your skin. Miiskin can help you with identifying changes on your skin. The How Identifying changes on your skin, remembering all of your skin’s appearance and remember to follow up on your own skin self-examinations on a regular basis is not easy without the support of technology, and this is where the Miiskin’s platform comes in. Our app helps you structure a process around your skin examinations and allows you to take and keep photos of your skin and moles for monitoring over time. It assists you in comparing photographs over time by allowing side-by-side viewing and parallel manipulation of the images. This makes it far easier for the user to identify differences between photos such as the appearance of a new mole, or a change to an existing mole. Our new Skin Mapping feature where AI and machine learning highlights all the moles and marks on your skin so you will be able to identify new marks on your skin is the first step in the direction of automatic detection of new marks and was covered by Forbes.com, https://cutt.ly/EwF4xlW The Why Miiskin was founded by Jon, who needed a better way to track the moles on his partner Rikke’s back. The doctor recommended Jon and Rikke to take photos and save them on a computer together with some written notes by pen and paper. He couldn’t help thinking that digital machine learning and photos of the moles could simplify and improve this process. 500,000 downloads and thousands of positive messages from happy users show that this is a concern many are looking to solve. Video of Skin Mapping: https://miiskin.com/skin-mapping/

The Pitch World Wide Narrative is developing Heroes of the Night / Nattens helter to help students understand how they use alcohol, to prevent future abuse, by taking a three month heroic journey of being sober and solving weekly challenges. The What We are working to prevent future alcohol abuse by challenging young people to reflect on how and when they use alcohol. We also believe that if the Nordic drinking culture is more inclusive, ie no social or peer pressure, more people will choose to participate and socialize on arenas we typically associate with lots of drinking. The How We challenge students at universities and university colleges in the Nordics to take three months sober while we give them weekly tasks to explore. They share content about their experiences with friends or other students publicly through our Nattens helter platform. We target campus by campus, starting with hiring four students part time to do the challenge while the rest of the students can watch their journey through social media. After a year we introduce an app so that the majority of the students who wish to do the challenge can do so with friends and student unions. The Why We were students once. And we know that it is easy to become a high functioning alcoholic if you are part of drinking culture that encourages high consumption. We have also seen accidents happen because of it. And we have seen that students who do not consume alcohol have a hard time taking part in the social life on campus because of that very same drinking culture.

The Pitch Our mission: to make the world more generous by helping charities to engage supporters in novel ways of giving and fundraising. The What The core of our story has always been a simple and clear mission: To make the world more generous. And enabling anyone to start a fundraiser is the first step to achieve this goal. We believe that if we can change the way fundraising is perceived, we can help more of the world’s wealth be donated to charities. We don’t aim at taking another slice of the donations going to charities, we want to increase the total amount of donations charities receive. The How BetterNow’s fundraising solution enables any charity to engage their supporters in peer-to-peer fundraising. At its core BetterNows solutions allow supporters of charities to speak up about their favourite cause and engage their network in fun and creative ways to fundraise. The solution is hosted and maintained by BetterNow but the charity can change the design so it matches their storytelling and branding. Our goal is that no donor or fundraiser will ever know who BetterNow is and that the charity receives the full attention. The Why Fundraising has histrionically been mostly related to printed campaigns, telemarketing, monthly printed newsletters and people fronting you in the street or knocking on your door with rattle cans. It has been surprisingly slow at moving online, maybe because the major part of donations traditionally comes from older generations. Now the new generations are online in many aspects of their lives, and thanks to the internet, information has crossed borders in a way society has not seen before. Peer-to-peer fundraising is growing with the wide use of social media, new generations seek self-realisation and ways to create their own identity outside of previous traditions and norms. Although peer-to-peer fundraising has been dominated by large giving platform, we learned donors want to engage with charities, not platforms. That's why we created BetterNow.

The Pitch Drupps turns air into clean drinking water wherever you are in the world. At any time. The What Water scarcity is building up all over the world, forcing us to think about water in new ways. We need to use less, recycle more, and find new sources. The atmosphere is such a source and Drupps is focused on bringing it to you. We envision urban areas in 2040 to be producing their own drinking water straight from the air. This will reduce limits to growth and help them find a sustainable balance with nature. Eco pressure on groundwater, rivers and lakes will be reduced, to the benefit of the entire eco system in the region. The How Drupps Concept is based on two modules – humidity absorption and evaporation – that combine together to create powerful and flexible atmospheric water generation. Our patented LiquiDes sorption technology efficiently absorbs humidity from ambient air and creates distilled and mineralized water. LiquiDes technology is leading the market hands-down in terms of best operating climate range and energy efficiency. The Why For a long time, lack of technological development prevented atmospheric water from fulfilling its potential as a major water provider for people. Common cooling of air is simply not good enough to create low-cost water outside the tropics. Drupps has developed technology for production of low-cost water from the atmosphere in climate conditions previously unreachable, including dry inland regions. This has enabled us to target markets never before targeted by airwater suppliers.

The Pitch BroadBit has developed a novel low-cost, high-performance, robust, safe, eco-friendly and scalable sodium chloride (table salt) battery technology with 50% more energy per unit cost and 25% more energy per unit mass as lithium-ion. The What 100x growth is expected in battery use in the coming decades due to electric vehicle and new energy generation technologies (e.g. wind and solar) if batteries are able to overcome the four key problems of Lithium-ion batteries limiting uptake: high cost, long charging time, low energy capacity, limited scalability and flammability. BroadBit is uniquely able to overcome all these key barriers to growth. BroadBit literally enables the electrification of transportation and the uptake of intermittent energy sources to replace fossil fuels. The How BroadBit's batteries are uniquely based on sodium chloride (table salt), enabling exceptionally high power and energy, low material and manufacturing costs and safe and stable performance by avoiding the costly and dangerous failure modes of Li-ion batteries. No other commercial battery technology uses sodium chloride as the active material. Our advantages compared to Lithium-ion are: 1) 50% higher energy per cost 2) 25% higher energy per weight 3) More environmentally friendly, scalable and sustainable 4) Simpler, open air manufacturing 5) Safer (non flammable, no risk of overcharging) 6) More durable (no risk of undercharging, 2x the operating temperature range: -20 to +60C) The Why We started the company to solve the last remaining problems to the mass market update of wind and solar energy and electric vehicles: insufficient energy density, high cost, limited raw materials, and poor safety of existing batteries. After thinking and experimenting for several years, we developed our high performance, cheap, scalable and safe solution. Once that was verified with several third parties, we founded the company to change the world.

Alteruna develops software for training healthcare professionals in virtual reality (VR) for safer care, less costs and more fun. There is a massive need for education and training in healthcare. New medical treatments should be mastered by the medical staff, existing treatments by new doctors and nurses. Everyone is on schedule and time is scarce. New training methods must be introduced to avoid malpractice. Alteruna has developed TeamSimulator to help surgeons and nurses train more and better. It is a virtual reality platform (VR) where operating teams, individually or together, can train technical skills like procedures and team-skills like cooperation. The company is now rapidly entering other areas of medical treatment training like heart stop (CPR) and Triage (to mark and select patients in war, accidents and pandemics like covid 19). Alteruna has developed a training platform using gaming technology and VR. Using it teams and individuals will be immersed in a virtual copy of their physical environment, interacting with purely digital objects or a mix of physical and digital objects. It is a long time since I had a day job. I have been an entrepreneur most of my professional life. The South General Hospital of Stockholm (Södersjukhuset) approached me and asked if we could combine VR and haptic robots. We said yes and showed them a proof of concept. With some grants we developed demonstrator of the project. This is what we like, to engage in a project in its true sense; you know where you, you know where you aim but the path is unknown and you most likely will end up somewhere else. That is my kind of a game.

The Pitch Aqsens Health has developed non-invasive and patented E-TRF method for health analysis. As a method it is accurate, quick and mobile with low costs of deployment, which makes it an ideal solution for preventive health screening. Especially for developing economies. The What Due to the continuous increase of healthcare costs we have to change the way we think and how to take preventive actions into agenda of national health issues - those actions will require new innovative healthtech and preventive funding mechanism like "Result Based Financing" (SIB models). AQH’s E-TRF method is highly versatile and it works with any human body liquid, saliva, urine or microbiota. Key application are Oral Cancer (India), Prostate Cancer (Finland / India / Mexico) and Preterm birth (EU project filed) but method can detect many other diseases as well. In India where we are working with the Public Health Foundation of India (www.phfi.org) and Ministry of Biotechnology to have over 100 00 saliva based oral cancer and anaemia tests done by 2020 with the target of getting our solution to be served millions in India. The How Aqsens Q-System consists of a reader, testkit (consumable) and intelligent algorithm on a tablet / laptop. With a low cost and ease of use / manage solution it can scale preventive health screening for masses. Being a non-invasive method it will not require basically any medical education nor laboratory conditions. The Why Initially I was intrigued by novelty of the innovation, core technology and key people working with it. Later when I realised healthcare challenges faced by our society, but especially in developing economies, I decided to put my full energy and competence to turn the fundamental idea to a reality. In addition eye opening visits to hospitals in Argentina (Buenos Aires), Mexico (Guadalajara) and several places (hospitals / villages) guided tours to slums) in India with NGO's (Vijayawada, Lucknow, Bangalore, Bangalore, Mumbai, Delhi) has further strengthen my view on how important new healthtech innovation and respective funding mechanisms are.

The Pitch Two dads fight childhood obesity together with scientists and medical doctors via wholesome food for kids The What We want to impact the global childhood obesity epidemic. The number of overweight or obese infants and young children (aged 0 to 5 years) increased from 32 million globally in 1990 to 41 million in 2016. The vast majority of overweight or obese children live in developing countries, where the rate of increase has been more than 30% higher than that of developed countries. If current trends continue the number of overweight or obese infants and young children globally will increase to 70 million by 2025. Consequences of obesity in childhood Obese children are more likely to develop a variety of health problems as adults. These include:cardiovascular disease, insulin resistance (often an early sign of impending diabetes), musculoskeletal disorders (especially osteoarthritis - a highly disabling degenerative disease of the joints), some cancers (endometrial, breast and colon), disability. The How We make wholesome food for kids – naturally. Our products are made to decrease kid's daily excess calorie intake and increase daily dietary fibre intake. We make juices, smoothies and breakfast cereals that are low in sugar and high in fibre without any artificial sweeteners and other unnecessary additives. All products are developed together with medical doctors in Finland and also Helsinki university scientists (who are experts in food technology and nutrition). We take a holistic approach and want also to empower parents and motivate kids to do more physical activity, sleep better and spend more time with people instead of screens. The Why We had our own ad agency focused on FMCG brands. We worked with many international and domestic brands e.g. Coca Cola, Nestle, Unilever, Snickers, Mountain Dew, etc.. After we had kids, we realized we would do anything so that they would have the best possible start in life. We soon realized that there were few healthy foods available for kids and we could not find any companies that put kids wellbeing first. So we contacted scientists Helsinki

The Pitch Our app helps people with severe reading and writing difficulties (7-10% of the population) including autism, brain damages etc. to become autonomous in the kitchen. It does so by developing an electronic shopping list using voice recognition and photos, with the option of purchasing cooking videos made with this particular target audience in mind. The What SDG - 10.2: In 2030, social, economic and political inclusion of all strengthened and promoted, regardless of age, gender, disability, race, ethnicity, origin, religion or economic or other status. Our app helps people with special disabilities and in the social field so they can become more independent in their daily lives. As a side effect, being able to cook after video recipes will contribute to increased health of the individual user. The How Many in the target group are not able to write / read their own shopping list or follow a food recipe. They can use intuitive tools (such as tablets and smartphones). We will take advantage of this and thereby help them become more independent, gain greater confidence and feel more free. They want to feel like others who do not have a disability. The app will help target group so they can create an electronic shopping list, using only voice recognition and photos, and make easy dishes for video recipes, without being able to read and write. The Why One of our team members (Birgitte) who is a specialized teacher, has developed and tested the idea of approx. 20 students, who eg are diagnosed autists. They find it difficult to make their own shopping list and follow cooking videos. She used physical pictograms and homemade videos. Her students use them today. She told about the idea for (Ninna and Nilofar), who suggested developing an app. We made a few calculations and saw the potential business, not only in Denmark, but every where in the World. (1 % of the population are diagnosed autists, 7-10 % are having severe reading and writing difficulties, 200.000 persons (in Denmark) suffer for brain damages from eg traffic accidents. Revenue generation in the app: Video part: (purchase in the app) Our test result shows that 82% of the target group in DK want to buy the video part => 311,600 people. We expect ¼ of these => 77,900 persons => DKK 15,502,100 Purchase list: Add ons: (311.600 people) RPM formula. A year in DK: DKK 22,219,302.

The Pitch Swancy is a platform for swapping clothes where people can give their preloved, but no longer used items a new home while getting something they fancy in return. The What We believe the throwaway culture that has emerged undermines the real value of fashion. Our closets are full of items we don't wear. Creating new clothes is a costly process both in terms of the environmental cost of producing fabric material, and in terms of labour cost of production. At the same time, fashion is meant to be enjoyed. We need to think differently and be smarter in the way we consume clothes, particularly in developed countries where abundance is becoming an environmental challenge. Through Swancy we promote sustainability through reuse and give people a chance to make use of the resources they have. The How Swapping is a win-win situation and one of the most sustainable and economical ways to enjoy fashion. Our aim is therefore to make swapping available for everyone at all times. We wish to inspire people to invest in quality rather than quantity. Sustainable and ethically produced products tend to be more expensive. Swancy provides a way for people to focus on quality while still having the freedom to experiment with their style. The Why We personally love swapping and find that both receiving and giving away preloved items sparks a lot of joy. Swancy's founder was inspired by the Nordic Swap Day, organised in Norway by Naturvernforbundet. She wanted to create a swap-option that was available throughout the year. When we started doing our market research the depth of the environmental and ethical challenges facing the fashion world were quickly revealed. We felt there was a need for a revolution in the way we consume, enjoy and think about fashion.

The Pitch We founded Equaon with a straightforward vision - to create the best shared mobility solutions that will push the world’s transition to the green sustainable transportation. The What Global warming has become a major concern for the entire world. In the last few decades, environmental impact of the petrol run vehicles, along with the rising oil prices, has led to a massive interest in electric transportation among the people. The world that we live in, is now counting record-high CO2 levels every minute. And, that’s resulting in the rising temperature. Conventional combustion vehicles produce toxic gases that are affecting the health of more than a million people every year. The How EQUAON is a mobility sharing company with the aim to provide effortless hardware and software solutions for smart cities / mobility operators. The company initiated its operations in Helsinki, Finland with the team of part-time core team members. We have developed high-quality electric scooters that will push the world’s transition to the green sustainable transportation. The Why Our journey started from a dream to make some small good things happen in this world today, so that we could abundantly rejoice in it tomorrow. We welcome every day with a continuous motion and willingness to improve, and to try new directions. That is why we strived to create vehicles that could make our motion a happy one, and prompt ecological thinking. One of our key goals since the very start was to stimulate people to rely on ecological means of transport. This is very important for our future!

The Pitch Healstack is AI-powered health app helping women overcome disordered eating and obesity. The What There is 1.9 billion people in the world who are overweight. Currently available tools are not working, especially fad diets. Therefore, we are challenging the diet industry and the global obesity epidemic by introducing a new way to manage weight. Our vision is to get 1 million women to stop fad dieting forever and instead embrace a balanced lifestyle by managing their habits and hunger cues instead of obsessing over food elimination and calorie counting. Women are heavily targeted by the diet industry, keeping them in the loop of not only unhealthy eating behaviors but low self-esteem. In its core, Healstack is tailored for people who struggle with disordered eating patterns and have previously failed to lose weight using conventional methods. Even though we focus on women at this stage, it is ideal for anyone who wants to re-balance their relationship with food, cheaper, easier and with long-term sustainability. The How To achieve our goal, we are introducing HungerQ - a hunger algorithm that helps stabilize and improve hunger cues for those who are unable to “hear their body” properly, due to years of dieting, disordered eating, and food restriction. We draw our learnings from eating disorder recovery research and root our principles in overcoming conditions like Binge Eating Disorder. In addition, with AI we are benchmarking healthy and unhealthy behaviors to recognize disordered patterns early on and apply recommendations that will help empower the individual to create new coping skills instead of food. The Why We built Healstack because we have recognized the need for people (especially women) to receive help with their disordered eating. Currently, in many countries the medical help is expensive, doctors are not familiar with disorders like BED and there is a deep-rooted stigma as well as fat-phobia. This idea was a way of finding a solution after one of our founders wasn't able to get help. Through research & tech exploration we found a combination that works which we tested with users. It helped our research participants. Once we saw the huge change it made, it was a no-brainer to keep up.

The Pitch A solution for data driven childhood obesity treatment. Families with obese children collect data at home with a smartphone application and connected devices. We analyze data to facilitate more effective and efficient treatment. Effect has been verified in a RCT and clinical practice. The What Childhood obesity has many negative effects including: reduced academic performance, lower expected income, increased risk for cardiovascular diseases, diabetes and overall reduced quality of life. The risks are normalized by successful weight loss. There is immense potential for personal and societal cost savings even if the individuals regain weight and become obese again as adults. Today the global prevalence of childhood obesity is around 5 % and much higher in most parts of the developed world. In the EU only about 10 % of obese children receive treatment. The How Provement is a software platform that connects families with obese children to treatment clinics. Patients/families collect data in their own home with a smartphone application and connected devices. The data is analyzed to set targets and give some feedback directly to the patients/families but our USP is that we give health care professionals better tools that allow them to treat more patients with better results given the same resources. We give clinics a tool to provide effective and cost efficient childhood obesity treatment. The Why We have people in our team who has worked with childhood obesity for a long time and understand the need for better tools to give to the health care professionals that work with the disease. We are close to the problem and realize how big impact we can have. The effects of successful weight loss are not only noticeable short term, but affects the entire life of the people we manage to help.

The Pitch Personal doctor in everybody's pocket The What We are focusing on UN SDG #3 on global health & wellbeing. For Etsimo, this means that we can help reduce premature mortality from non-communicable diseases through prevention and treatment, promote mental health and well-being and in large scale help bring better access to healthcare services globally. The How We measure this by analysing our diagnosis data from our clients and end-users and see how effective the preventive treatments are based on the care results. We offer Etsimo's platform to healthcare providers and other healthcare stakeholders that promote health and wellbeing and will focus in our go-to-market to emerging markets so we can bring better access to healthcare and enabling our end-users to take ownership of their personal health. The Why Etsimo was founded with the mission to help everyone on this planet to stay healthy, sustain a high quality of life, and prevent irreversible and chronic conditions. Founding of the company was inspired by personal experiences of our founders with the desire to fix inefficiencies in our current healthcare system and offer a solution that helps to transform the system.

The Pitch YouViaMe is a matchmaking app where friends help their single friends find long lasting healthy relationships, by matching them together with their other single friends. Every match is a date within 7 days. The What 3. Good Health and Well-Being Such mental disorders as depression can lead to suicide. Nearly 800,000 suicides occurred worldwide in 2015, with men about twice as likely to commit suicide as women. One of our biggest health issues is loneliness and its proven that people are more happy if they are in a relationship or have strong relationships around them. The How Many people want to find someone, but the landscape of finding someone isn't easy, especially as there is not easy to find someone when all the dating apps and services are built with gamification so that you get hooked but not find anyone. YouViaMe is not only the most safest dating app on the market, it's also fully focused on making people meet in real life. Users can't chat in the app, every match, facilitated by a friend that they trust and know, becomes a date within 7 days at our partners venue. The Why I became single and downloaded all the different dating apps on the market and realised rather quickly that none of the apps actually want you to find someone. Let's use Tinder for example, all users have a tinder score and you can only get matched with people within your score, if you swipe yes on to many, then they will only show you everyone who said no etc. I was tired of the way they we're built and just wanted to change it and help people meet. In YouViaMe, when a single user finds someone, they just become matchmaker for their single friends, more "pay it forward" thought than just locking people in to the app and not allowing them to find love.

The Pitch Mindfit is a selhelp app that focuses on mental training! The What The goal is to help people get better quality of life through mental training. Struggling with mental health issue is a touchy topic. Mindfit have the potential to reach people who would otherwise not receive help by removing the barriers to treatment. Mindfit is designed so that it simulates some of the issue and techniques a psychologist wold use in his or her first meeting with an individual seeking help. We make therapeutic techniques more accessible. Mindfit is suitable for all kinds of people in difficult situations or who are in a period of their lives where they feel stressed, worried, anxious, need motivation or are depressed and lack energy. The tool is inspired by well-recognized treatments such as cognitive therapy, positive psychology and EMDR, but also by the more general communication and therapy techniques used in psychology. The How It’s easy to get stuck in negative thoughts and feelings about yourself when you go trough a tough time like stress, lack of energy and motivation or depression. With simple steps and techniques Mindfit teaches users to shift their focus away from negative thought patterns and low self-esteem, to a greater sense of mastery and positive thoughts about themselves. It helps users to be aware of their problem areas, and gain insight into what prevents them from changing their situation, in part by becoming aware of negative thoughts and feelings. Mindfit helps users to set goals, focus on and achieve them. This goal setting process helps the user to refocus the negative energy into a constructive and positive experience raising self-esteem and reinforcing positive thoughts. Change takes time and usually consists of both progress and setbacks. Mindfit helps you see that you are on the right track! The Why We want to help others – shift focus, set limits and get a greater sense of empowerment with respect to the challenges we all face in our everyday lives. Everyone has periods where they feel depressed, worried or anxious as a result of private or work-related challenges. Adversity and setbacks are a normal part of life.

The Pitch engaging patient for better health outcome in thier treatment pathway The What Healthcare providers are faced with the challenge of low care plan adherence by patients, inefficient administration, poor population reach and low patient retention rates. Moreover, it is considered that healthcare provider takes responsibility of the patients’ treatment, which is quite challenging because of the ever-growing gap between doctor-patient ratio.
