Disconnect between healthcare provider and patient’s in-between encounters during patient pathway causing poor care outcome and wasted care. Our offering helps providers to be in continuous dialog with patients even beyond the care setting to improve care outcome, reduce care cost, enhance care experience and strengthen patient relationship. The How mfore provides the technology platform and service for healthcare providers, to utilize mobile communication channels to have a continuous dialogue with patients and care givers (e.g. family members) outside the care setting and between encounters. Our offering enables healthcare providers to converse with patients and care givers with relevant information at right times to educate, remind and reinforce the prescribed care and get insights to patient’s progress in the care process. mfore’s Patient Engagement Service (PES) provides simple to use mobile communication services to enable monitoring, adherence, counselling for healthcare providers and their patients. Patient Engagement Solution - “Simple and Functional” whether you are a patient, a doctor or a surgeon. Our solutions are simple to use but incredibly functional. Making excellent patient engagement accessible, available and affordable by design. The Why Personal and family experience of disconnect with healthcare provider during the treatment when not at healthcare location. The need for engaging patient is even more, considering the ever increasing patient numbers and needs as well lower healthcare literacy rate among general population. Especially when most of the time patients are looking for the answers to following questions when they are outside of hospital settings: • What is my main problem? • What do I need to do? • Why is it important for me to do this? Hence the role of Doctors and healthcare professionals becomes more challenging, as they need to educate the patient as well. But then the shortage of time on healthcare professionals, a patient does not get satisfying or meaningful answers. That leads to poor or low treatment adherence. This is where the solution like ours come as conduit between patients and doctors that enables the continuous communication (two-way), resulting in better healthcare outcomes.

The Pitch Formal Digital ID for the underserved. A decentralized digital identification system that works eith limited internet and electricity, designed for those who don’t have any ID, but is more advanced than the digital iD system in Estonia. The What Provide ID for 1.1B who don’t have ID The How Innovative, secure, and offline-capable identification system enabling strong two-factor authentication for face-to-face encounters and for online services The Why Provide access to social and financial services, land ownership, employment and voting to the underserved

The Pitch Inforglobe provides software for participatory analysis and decision making. We help our clients to become more engaging organisations and succeed in challenging multi-stakeholder processes, involving your clients and stakeholders. Our Multiview tool helps especially in risk management, quality and strategy processes. Our roots are in peace mediation and systems research. Combining dialogue with information visualisation, our dynamic software help build common understanding between people. The What Peace and security The How We are a spinnoff from CMI president Ahtisaari's conflict resolution office. We have developed our software for peace mediation helping conflict parties to do shared analysis and build common understanding. We have worked with CMI over 7 years and we have helped peace processes in Iraq, Ukraine, Libya, Irak and 10 other countries. Currently we work for the peace process in Yemen. Our tool have in part helped to device several national reconciliation strategies and advanced peace talks. In addition to our work on peace and security we have worked with 30 large nordic brands such as Elisa, Sweco, Skanska, SOK, etc. We wish to develop our tools for the use of companies and societies at large. We want to develop something groundbreaking in the future utilizing AI and AR. Our tools currently already base on advanced systems research of Aalto University. Our business model needs to be focused for the purposes of commercial viability and scaling. But we strongly believe that keeping our focus also on large societal challenges enables us to reach real life measurable impact in people's lives. We do currently measurement of social relations and tensions between different ethnic groups, namely Finns and refugees. We believe that humans need to be prepared for even not-far-from-apocalyptic scenarios (climate refugees, warfare) in the next decades, where the ability to live peacefully becomes the priority number one for all mankind. We need initiatives globally, regionally and locally to sustain peace, to prevent and resolve conflicts. That's why we work with the UN and Inforglobe's CEO Mikaeli lectures at the UN System Staff College on subject matter ICT for Peace. It will be a crucial factor how technologies are harnessed for the good, and not the bad. It requires visionary thinking, but also very practical work with people, on the ground, in the mud. We would love to be part of your ecosystem and work together towards a more humane and technology savy world. The Why To become the world's most respected technology house for building common understanding between people.

The Pitch Checheza connects quality educational content with local learners, starting in East Africa. The approach is to work with educational experts globally and connect tested and validated learning games to their platform. Localization of this content is done with local partners, to make sure content is locally relevant for children. The platform is then packaged into an app, through which children can learn and practice literacy and math. The What That every child finish primary school. The How Checheza started as a small project in 2015 by 4 of the current team members. We wanted to understand why many children drop out of school, and see if we could find a solution using technology. We realized there exists plenty of high quality digital educational content around the world, but it was neither accessible nor relevant for the children who needed it the most. This has become our mission: to build a platform where great content can be localized and delivered on the devices and through the channels that are accessible to children in the risk of dropping out of school or finishing school without essential skills. In september 2018, after understanding the problem and our users, and building our first game, we felt ready to register our company Checheza AB in Sweden, and in November 2018 we launched our Beta in Uganda. We are an impact-oriented startup, aiming to combine social and financial sustainability. The Why Provide families with an effective and engaging, digital complement to school, empowering them to take control of their kids education.

The Pitch aiten is the digital solution for chronic disease. We combine healthy habits, a certified measurement device and online access to a personal doctor for a holistic approach with the sole aim of giving the individual with the chronic disease all the tools they need to be in the drivers seat of their condition. The What Peace of mind, confidence and health The How My wife got diagnosed with hypertension (high blood pressure) and the challenges she faced with it prompted us to create a solution. We saw first hand the difficulties of tackling a chronic disease with massive changes needed in both lifestyle, lifelong medication and lack of access to healthcare. There was no solution available so we decided to create one. Over a billion people in the world suffer from high blood pressure and it causes one stroke/heart attack every 2 seconds. It is estimated that 1.5 billion people will have high blood pressure by 2025. This is completely unacceptable! We have packaged our solution into a subscription that we provide directly to patients. When patients sign up for our service they get a certified measurement device, support for lifestyle change and access to a personal doctor online. We are not a tech company, we are a digital healthcare company. Our service has two sides to it: - One side facing the patient - One side facing the healthcare professional (e.g. doctor) Making the lives of patients easier and at the same time making doctors lives easier. The Why Empowering people to be in the drivers seat of their chronic disease by combining healthy habits and healthcare online.

The Pitch Mode Sensors AS (Mode) is a digital healthcare company redefining the way hydration is clinically diagnosed by combining our wearable sensor technology with cloud-based data analytics and machine-learning. The What Contribute to Good Health and Well-being The How Mode Sensors AS (Mode) is a digital healthcare company, established in 2016, with the purpose of developing and selling the next-generation sensor-technology in healthcare. We’re currently 13 employees with complementary backgrounds and expertise sitting at the IoT-incubator FAKTRY in Trondheim, Norway. Our first objective is to redefine the way hydration is clinically diagnosed by combining our wearable sensor technology with cloud-based data analytics and machine learning. With this solution, we aim to contribute to better health, well-being and a more sustainable healthcare sector by preventing dehydration - especially among elderly who are particularly prone to dehydration. In the 2.5 years since Mode was established, we have had significant achievements in our quest to introduce the solution in the market, including: 1) Winner of the first Innovation Partnership in Europe for sensor-system Mode Vivo, which was considered the best solution, to prevent dehydration among elderly, among 30 suppliers in Europe. 2) Attained commitment from customers to invest in the development of Mode Vivo, both in terms of financing and in-kind. In total, customers have committed approx. €1.6 million and 3000 hours in-kind. 3) Successfully completed several publicly supported R&D-projects (FORNY, Eurostars, RFF) enabling us to achieve TRL 6 for our novel sensor-system. The Why We are building technology enabling the next generation of healthcare services.

The Pitch Drowzee is on a mission to provide humans with the superpower of falling asleep on command, using neurotechnology. The What One out of every 10 adults suffer from chronic insomnia. The sleep research societies calls for innovative approaches and techniques in the treatment of insomnia. Drowzee is collaborating with the healthcare system to develop a scalable and drug-free personalized treatment for people with sleep deprivation. The How The team behind Drowzee consists of experienced entrepreneurs and engineers based in the tech-capital Trondheim, Norway. Drowzee develops the first commercially available, research grade sleep onset reduction device together with their users and the healthcare system. We have a working prototype that has been tested in two separate projects. The next step is to develop a minimum viable product together with our industrial partners and test it in a clinical environment. The Why Drowzee is on a mission to provide humans with the superpower of falling asleep on command, using neurotechnology. The first stepping stone is to provide a neural learning tool that identifies and guides the user towards a mental state of drowsiness. We are looking for driven people that want to contribute to solving a global problem and shape the future by working with the human mind.

The Pitch 1.5 billion smartphones were created in 2018...so what have we done with the old ones. Today the average person has 2-5 phones sitting in a drawer somewhere at home simply because they do not know what to do with them. We help make it simple for people to take their old device and #PassItOn The What At Lokalist, we are building a platform that aims to raise awareness of just how unsustainable the smartphone production industry actually is. We find solutions to reduce the number of phones being produced, use the ones we have already made to their full potential, and recycle those that are no longer useful. We believe one of the key drivers of change is knowledge. Once you realize the average smartphone takes over half of the elements from the periodic table to produce. Elements that are toxic, dangerous to mine, and end up irresponsibly disposed of in our landfills after use. Once you know 80% of children in a small town in China have developed lead poisoning because of the high amounts of toxic metals leaking from e-waste into their drinking water, or you hear the stories of Chilean miners being paid less than $2 a day to extract the raw material that makes your screen 15% brighter...well you begin to want to make a difference. The How Lokalist makes it simple to know what to do with your old smartphone when you upgrade to a new one, by comparing all the different options to sell, trade-in, or donate your old phone and choose the option that best suits each user and their device. Simply go to the site, enter your device, check a few boxes to let us know the condition the device is in, and compare the different options to sell, trade-in, or donate near you. The Why We are just now beginning to talk about how different actions we take are impacting the environment and the lives of other people around the world. Technology has somehow flown under the radar as a necessary evil. While we do not want to halt the progress and benefits that new technology brings to the lives of everyone, we would like to make people more aware of what it takes to create their devices so that they are more aware of the effects of irresponsibly wasting it.

The Pitch Straxfix is a Med-tech company producing a ready-to-use system to improve the way bone fractures are handled by healthcare professionals. We aim to disrupt Orthopedics, starting with upper extremity fractures, where current standard of care involves burning fingers, working under time pressure and waiting for wet bandages to dry… resulting in 20% rework. The What Setting new standard in Orthopedics The How Our product, Straxfix, consists of a processed felt cast and a lamp for hardening. It does not require fixed installations, special treatment rooms or to be confirmed by the ER or the OR departments. Our product is ready to use straight out of the packing, which eliminates preparation and waiting times before patients receive the treatment they need. The Straxfix® Orthopedic System does not change current work flow, but it enables doctors and nurses to use this time to focus on patients more meaningfully. Time efficiency is the core of our concept: doctors are able to discharge their patients straight after treatment, as the bandage is fully harden in just 30 seconds. The system is developed to stage where we have fully functional prototypes. We are searching for Contract Manufacturing Organisations in order to be able to go to the market. Starxfix wants to be a R&D company. Sales will over time be handled by distributors. Customers will be private and public health care organisations. The Why Our mission is to improve the way fractures are handled, saving both time & money to global health care systems.

The Pitch We combine the picture book with the audio book to create a super rewarding and fun reading and learning experience for kids in pre-schools and schools. We have books with audio in more than 30 languages so that kids from all backgrounds can be included and discover the joy of reading. The What We want kids to read more and better The How We combine the picture book with the audio book in the same digital format and make them accessible to pre-schools and schools in our iOS and Android apps. We hire narrators/actors all across the world that narrate our books, so that kids from any background can gain access to wonderful childrens' stories in their own language, and thereby helping them learn to read and become much more interested in books and reading generally. Reading skills is the key to succeeding in school and modern society. Our service is available through a subscription model and since we launched our product in Sweden at the beginning of this year tens of thousands of kids already have access to our service through pre-schools, schools and municipalities that have purchased our service. The Why We are on a mission to make kids read more and better

The Pitch Every year 1 out of 4 people in the world pay bribes to access public services. Systematic corruption undermines people’s trust in political and economic systems, institutions, and their leaders. We believe that the power of technology can be used to tackle this world problem. Klarity empowers citizens and organisations to act on corruption experienced in their everyday lives by providing digital tools to hold responsible officials accountable. The What Our vision is a world without corruption The How Klarity was founded by entrepreneurs with a passion for standing up against injustice. We are owned and funded by the Swedish foundation Norrsken. Our team consists of skilled individuals who have experience with developing internet services and launching them around the world. We are founded upon the aspiration to tackle one of the world’s biggest fiends; corruption. Our drive stems from the simple idea that technology can be the key to fundamentally eliminate corruption at its roots. Klarity empowers citizens and organisations to act on corruption experienced in their everyday lives. We hold a unique role in society creating a community that connects citizens, activists, journalists, CSOs, and government bodies. We believe that for petty corruption to cease to exist it needs to become a high risk low gain activity. Our method deters potential offenders, it involves organisations that drive change on a policy level and promotes good governance - highlighting the heroes holding public office who fight to make their local communities better. We provide an app where citizens can act on corruption experienced in their everyday lives by providing an online community where activists anonymously crowdsource video-based evidence. We are starting small, launching the platform with local activists in the suburbs Accra, Ghana, in order to gain proof of concept and understand how the platform can be optimised in order to combat all forms of human rights’ abuses in both private and public sector institutions. In each country we will work closely with Key Community Partners that have proven track records of combating corruption and mobilizing citizens. Like any community, Klarity will grow and evolve with its users and develop over time. Klarity’s journey has only just begun. The Why We are on a mission to create a movement and sense of urgency to act on corruption.

The Pitch Popit has developed the world's first smart pill tracker solution (device, app, cloud) for pills that come in blisters, addressing about 75% of solid drugs in the world. The solution does not require changes to medication packaging and has the potential of helping hundreds of millions of patients. Popit's solution reduces missed pills by over 80%. Our device, Popit Sense, automatically detects with patented technology when pills are ‘popped’ from various types of blister packs. The What Get all patients to take their meds. The How Popit Sense improves medication adherence and provides unprecedented data on how pills are consumed, without making changes to the blister packages on the market. Popit Sense & the app automatically track pills. The app logs the pill consumption history and reminds only if pills are missed. All data is synced to our cloud in real-time, where we can also push messages to users. The solution makes it easier to stay on track with medication and also provides a way for caregivers to follow up on how caretakers are doing with their meds. We want to improve medical adherence and quantify medication in collaboration with the pharmaceutical industry by developing products and services that motivate, encourage and remind patients into taking medications in a consistent manner. Adherence is an important topic and a major problem. Every year over 300 000 people die as a result of it and the healthcare system is burdened by over $400Bn in avoidable costs. If we are able to improve this problem by even one percent, the change is tangible. 80% of solid drugs in the world are delivered in blisters. Our addressable market is easily over 1Bn patients. Furthermore 99% of solid drugs in clinical trials are delivered in blisters. Milestones: - Closing €1.2M seed round (08/2017) - Starting Indiegogo campaign for consumers (11/2017) - Results from 1st clinical pilot (03/2018) - Starting product shipments to consumers and Pharma, publish app (08/2018) - Starting two new clinical pilots (10/2018) - Establishing a strategic partnership with a major pharmaceutical company (10/2018) - Investment A round (Q4 2018 / Q1 2019) The Why Every person taking their pills on time and according to prescription. Medication quantified into digital format to tackle non-adherence.

The Pitch The Target Aid digital platform connects non-profit organisations with grass root philanthropists so that passionate donors can find and support a specific project and follow the effect of their actions. With advanced technology, amazing user experience and innovative features Target Aid creates a transparent and collaborative way to connect people, passions, and projects giving charities access to new audiences, fundraising in a smart and cost-efficient way. The What Re-invent fundraising The How There is a never ending need of help in our world. Future donors expect more participation and transparency. Today there are several barriers that need to be lifted to get more people to give, and active donors to give a little more. We believe in the power of people and the ability of digitalization to accomplish exponential improvement. (Philanthropy = love of humans) Target Aid aims to be the go-to place for modern philathropy. People meet, communicate and engage online. We use digital platforms and market places. Charity must be online too, closing the generation gap. Ready for the Millennials supporting particular projects in areas of interest instead of entire organizations. Rewarding transparency and trust. Target Aid for donors: Find a variety of projects across organizations. Fight poverty today, save the planet tomorrow! Support what you are passionate about. You decide when, how much and how often. Follow your engagements in one place. You decide what information you want and from whom. Share! Raise awareness through your online communities. See the effect at Target Aid. Target Aid for organizations: Gives you free access to new audiences. No effort is required to find them, Target Aid does it for you. Diversify! Place your projects in multiple categories and customize your offers, so more people can find them. Product use cases: Increase giving by efficiently bringing people, passions and projects together. Recruitment of donors, members, ambassadors and volunteers. New partnerships and partnerships across project and organizational boundaries. Create and manage communities within donor groups. Data collection and a deeper understanding of donor behaviors, applicable for thought leadership within charity and further long-term development of the entire charity industry. This arena can be technologically equipped to increase control of how donated funds are used - for example by using blockchain technology. The Why By bringing people, passions and projects together in a collaborative way, we can change the world by the power of the people.

The Pitch TAUKO is a sustainable nordic fashion house based in Helsinki, Finland. Our extended lifecycle concept for fashion help value-based, nature-loving women who want to help create a more sustainable world by reducing textile waste/depletion of natural resources and increasing the lifecycle and longevity of a garment. The What On top of the consumer textiles, we are troubled by the BtoB textile waste flows that are an unseen possibility for local fashion industry for high quality, scalable material source. The How TAUKO was founded in 2008 by us, lifelong best friends Mila Moisio and Kaisa Rissanen. We both graduated from university to become art researchers, but the thrive to work for something that has more immediate effect on our environment and culture pushed us to create our own sustainable fashion brand. Our mission was always to create carefully designed products that live up to our own expectations. During the first years we gathered a lot of information about how textiles are recycled within textile rental companies, why are the textiles discarded in the first place and what kind of qualities these textiles have. In 2013 we released the first collection based on the reuse of rental textiles. The company, TAUKOdesign oy was established in 2014. Today we present two full womenswear collections annually. They reflect our passion for contemporary art and design and respect for sustainable values. Our unique TAUKO recycling concept is based on local, discarded rental textiles as the raw materials of the production. Working closely together with local producers and research groups, we constantly develop new methods to prepare recycled materials for our collections. These materials are mostly textiles that have been used in Finnish and German restaurants and hotels. In addition to discarded textiles, we also utilize surplus knits and yarns, and organic wool for our collections. We show our respect to the skilful people working for our production and visit them regularly in Finland and Estonia. TAUKO stands for a break or a pause in Finnish. It describes the silent and still movement that is almost impossible to notice. The Why We want to show how to create a high quality fashion brand based on reuse of waste textiles.

The Pitch Sarita is a welfare technology startup based in Aarhus. Did you know that in some nursing homes, caregivers still use pagers for alarm notifications? While elderly is the fastest growing user segments worldwide, the current technology for caregiving is outdated and stigmatising. Sarita CareTech has decided to tap into this market and raise the bar of functionality and design for caregiving tech by build beyond state-of-art technology for elderly and their caregivers. The What Safety, decency and independence for elderly The How The inspiration for the products of Sarita came from our CEO Nikolaj K. Nielsen, who worked in a nursing home in Denmark and experienced limitations of modern caregiving tech first-hand. Nikolaj gathered a team to build Sarita CareTech, a company that would build beyond state-of-art solutions to support elderly and their caregivers. Currently, Sarita CareTech develops and markets hardware and software for electronic wearable devices. The main purpose of Sarita is to provide an easy to use technology to the elderly population, facilitating safety, independence and peace of mind, and an intuitive remote patient monitoring system for the caregivers and relatives of the elderly. This is achieved by the development of a personal emergency response system (Sarita Pearl) including auto-fall detection based on machine learning, intercom, call button, GPS & Safety zone connected to a cloud based monitoring platform and Android application for caregivers (Sarita Lighthouse). Sarita has won in a few startup competitions (Telia Jump 2017, Care-Ware Next 2017), and has developed products in a collaboration with several care institutions. Sarita's products Pearl and Lighthouse are market ready, with the first distribution agreement closed in Denmark. Sarita's business model is B2B, with focus on sales through distributors to private and public care institutions. The Why By developing innovative and value creating solutions, Sarita CareTech lays the way for automated, seamless and intuitive caregiving.

The Pitch Cerebriu improves global healthcare by helping radiology using AI solutions. Our real-time workflow solutions are powered by a deep learning-based AI backbone that provide fully automated image analysis, initially of MRI brain scans. The What For hospitals and clinics who cannot keep up with demand for medical image diagnostics, Cerebriu Apollo is a software solution that improves productivity and quality. Hospitals and clinics that perform medical imaging diagnostics examinations are across the globe struggling to keep up with an ever increasing demand on radiology while maintaining a high level of quality in diagnostics Up to 60% of time is spent looking at healthy images Up to 30% of patients have no clinically relevant findings Up to 15% patients are recalled for further scanning Up to 15% time spent determining the medical protocol Mean time to report is often not better for critical patients than for healthy patients Patients may be applied contrast unnecessarily, especially by younger doctors The How Cerebriu Apollo aims at addressing different pain-points in the radiological workflow: Smart Protocol: Enable to automate brain MRI protocol sequences during scanning with minimal manual intervention. Cerebriu’s smart protocol will provide a real-time classification of critical candidate pathologies from which specialized protocols may be selected. Image Reporter: Enable automatic navigation to findings in the scan both in real-time (during scanning), and during image interpretation/reporting. Triage Advisor: As a biproduct of smart protocol, the radiologist will be able to prioritize report generation of patients based on the severity of the underlying pathology. Unlike competitors focusing on diagnostics during radiologist image reading or generating more data through magic sequences during scanning, we focus on simple workflow efficiency gains automating tasks that disturb radiologists, while improving the attention to the clinically relevant findings. The Why Over the past couple of decades, the growth of the global middle class in conjunction with the growth in use of medical imaging has been stretching radiology to the brink of collapse. Teleradiology centers in low-cost countries has augmented radiologists in developed countries, to allow developed countries continued access at a tolerable level of quality, but at the sacrifice of most of the world’s population. Over the next decade the demanding middle-class will grow from nearly 3 billion to 5 billion people. Radiologists are amongst the most stressed out and sick-leave stricken population of medical doctors. Much of their work is very repetitive and the workload is ever increasing. In developed countries radiologists report on 10-15 patients per day at an approx. 4% error rate, while in developing countries this production can supersede 50 patients per day with undisclosed error rates. https://www.linkedin.com/pulse/medical-imaging-what-all-fuss-robert-lauritzen/

The Pitch YOU helps knowledge workers reduce stress and achieve a balanced state of high performance. We do it through personalized micro-actions and light coaching. The goal: A balanced state of high performance. We often put all our focus on either balance or performance. But truly exceptional performance doesn’t exist without balance – that’s what allows you to sustain it over time. And great performance is meaningful and rewarding in a way even the best free time cannot provide. This is the true future of work. The What Based on research. Made for busy people. The How All research on behavior change comes down to the same thing – sustainable change works best in small steps. Micro-actions help you turn knowledge into action, take the first step (and the second, third, fourth…), and form sustainable, new habits. Because the small things truly matter. The Why Brilliant things happen when we take action. Our mission is to improve the health, wellbeing or productivity of individuals.

The Pitch Media Sifter is a decentralized community bringing evidence back to the news. A transparent platform which collects all the perspectives in one place. A fresh opportunity for authors to be rewarded for investigation and accuracy. A trustworthy, ad-free space that helps readers get to the bottom of the story. The What We Are The Community Changing the Rules of the Media Game The How Today's Media Landscape is overwhelming, noisy and biased. We are drowning in an ocean of opinions, agendas and 'fake news'. A pay-per-click world of sensationalism and click-bait, all fuelled by advertising. With no alternative, until now. The Why Media Sifter cuts through the noise aggregating news by topic, giving you relevant journalism and all the perspectives on the story.

The Pitch Parking energy is a Finland-based technology oriented parking electricity operator. We are solving issues within electric car-charging in real estate environment. We have over 20 years of experience in electric vehicles charging growing from the original grassroots tech movement. We combine this with deep algorithms, so that we can offer the most sophisticated local grid load balance based in real user experience. We offer the whole value chain as a one integrated service, resulting in reliability, affordability and seamless user experience. All the while, tackling one of the most pressing challenges of modern times: clean and sustainable energy. The What Be cool and keep the planet cool as well. The How The electric vehicle revolution is on its way to hit the streets. Every major car manufacturer is now bringing mid-priced electric vehicles for mass markets. Some have even announced to end the production of gasoline cars. States in wide spectrum have decided to ban all new fossil fuel cars. As the prices go down, the adoption of electric vehicles can be as disruptive as the as for the smart phone outdating the older cell phone. Only one problem has remained: How to charge the car in real estate environment. The current method of installing single chargers here and there is expensive and cumbersome. Each new set of chargers implies a new project with electrical engineering, acquisition of chargers and electrical contracting. The limits of electrical distribution center can suddenly form a barrier for adding new chargers. These difficulties have prompted the experts to forecast that the problem of charging in real estate will substantially slow down the adoption of electric vehicles. That has been the case, until now. Parking Energy Platform solves all the issues with a single stroke. The crucial distinction is to separate the cabling from the chargers. In the heart of the solution is a quick connector: In a garage, the cabling can be brought to each slot, ending to a robust and inexpensive connector. When the tenant buys an electric vehicle, the charger can be ordered to the parking slot for the next day. The installment of a charger with fitting quick connector is plug-and-play. It takes only a minute and requires no electrical planning or composing official electrical installment records. The benefit for the real estate owner is twofold. First, a large parking area can be prepared to be EV-ready with a single investment. Second, the real estate is freed from managing the installment projects, maintenance and metering the electricity. The cost of the cabling is less than 1% of the cost of a parking slot, but can add value many times over. The Why Electric vehicle revolution: millions of affordable EVs will find their home in residential buildings and the parking lots of workplaces.

The Pitch Connectivity is vital in this day and age. We want to provide fast connectivity to remote areas, and ensure a more efficient management of communication during emergencies. We do all this at a very small deployment cost. Software 4G and 5G mobile core network enables mobile communications with off the shelf LTE devices and uses Software Defined Network (SDN) technology to create different slices in the same infrastructure. The network slices can have different resources and traffic priorities for critical communications and isolate traffic with different Quality of Service. The mobile core run on Virtualized Network Functions (NFV) which allows to deploy and tear down the mobile core network based on demand. Mobile networks 4G and 5G require a large investment because they need a lot of computing resources and large server rooms. This is because the system has been designed for large deployments of millions of subscribers. Cumucore Oy has designed the same 4G/LTE mobile core network with smaller deployments in mind. This enables us to provide mobile connectivity to smaller areas having a population of 100.000 users or less. We believe connectivity is vital in this day and age, and want to provide it to remote areas at a very small deployment cost. The other problem we are solving is that often remote areas have networks lacking sufficient capacity. Our Software Defined Network technology analyses the network and creates smaller divisions or slices of the network. This management of the network is done dynamically so if there is an emergency, the system immediately will create the slice and isolate the critical communications from the rest of the network. However, if there is no emergency, then the entire network is available for everyone. The What Provide fast connectivity to remote areas, and enable efficient communication during emergencies. The How Cumucore brings a disruptive solution that integrates Network Function Virtualization (NFV) and Software Defined Networking (SDN) to deliver a flexible and affordable mobile services to truly connect the world. Virtualized Packet Core Cumucore offers the first of its class software based LTE packet core to be deployed in the cloud including mobility, user management and traffic optimizations. Packet core software as a service to be integrated with or without Software Defined Networks (SDN). SDN mobile backhaul Cumucore has designed and implemented a Hardware component that can be installed in existing off the shelf base stations (i.e. eNB) to convert legacy mobile backhaul into Software Defined Network mobile backhaul. Mobile Edge computing and content delivery Cumucore with the usage SDN offers the Software components that allow to optimize the content delivery within any location of the access network. This product allows the mobile operators to reduce up to 50% the traffic in their networks. The Why Disrupt mobile networks, provide flexible connectivity for everyone, and create new possibilities to truly connect the world.

The Pitch Twoact are apps designed as a therapy session. We know that dealing with the problems at an early stage will prevent them from getting worse. The What Because good health comes from the inside. The How TWOACT offers products in "self help", today we have an application suite consisting of the most common problem pictures and work on expanding our portfolio continuously. Our smartphone applications are based on solid experience from therapy, treatment, and depression. With this background in TWOACT and our partners' important knowledge, we have been able to create these customized "apps" based on KBT as a framework. Why TWOACT? The idea behind TWOACT came to us as small messages in our conversation's business. On several occasions throughout the years, we have been told how often awaiting the search for help for his man. There are very many who wait for a longer period of time where they are mentally ill or suffer from an abuse problem, which is often associated with both guilt and shame. We found that there was a tool that could help the individual to identify, learn and understand the situation at an earlier stage, we could help people to "grow up in gravel". TWOACT's applications can be resembled a therapy call packed in an app. With the help of the app, you can chart your life situation, learn how you think, why your body behaves like it does, and it gives you advice and tools to make a change. You can do this discreetly and anonymously. If you experience difficulties in changing your life situation yourself with our apps, it's good to put away debt and shame and seek more help IRL. The Why Prevent addiction and behavior problems by strength peoples mental health

The Pitch Just take your medicines as prescribed by your doctor, and you will earn stars – therefore DrugStars. The DrugStars app lets you use the stars to activate donations to charities – and it’s free. In addition, we also offer you access to health-care vouchers that support your life with your disease. You will get a reminder to collect your stars at the time you have entered as your time to take a dose of medicine. The What #givingbytaking The How With DrugStars app for iOS or Android you as a patient can feel even better about taking your medicine. And you can help others while helping yourself! It's called ""Giving by Taking"" and that's what it means to be part of DrugStars. Every time you remember to take your medication on time, as prescribed by your doctor, you get a star! Each star is rewarded to a medical charity. With your support, and the DrugStar tracker, other patients stay healthy and can have a better life too. - Set up a daily reminder with DrugStar app - Take dose as prescribed by your doctor - Never miss a pill again - Earn reward stars everyday - DrugStars turns rewards into donations for you - Select your favorite medical charity to donate to - Now with DrugStars you are ""Giving by Taking"" With a daily reminder to take your meds or vitamins from the DrugStar assistant, you are in control. And it's simple and easy to help others. All patient organisations can be a part of the DrugStars platform – for free. The Why Imagine if every dose of medicine taken worldwide generated a donation to better health care! That is the vision of the DrugStars global movement.

The Pitch We make fine silicon solar cell threads in the size of the hair that are flexible to bend. The solar cell threads can be embedded in variety of substrates such as facade, glass, vehicle composite etc. By choosing appropriate substrate, we can customize solar cell products for different applications with unique features. The What Affordable and flexible solar cells made from fine solar cell threads The How Our team has developed a technique to refine silicon to solar grade threads by melt drawing silicon powder within glass cladding. The main advantage of the technique is that it reduces manufacturing costs by 50%. The silicon threads are mono crystalline silicon with the potential to reach efficiency of 23%. In addition, the silicon threads are flexible to a diameter of 5mm, and compatible with a variety of substrates appropriate for different applications including building facades, carbon composites of cars and trains. By making solar energy more affordable and desirable for customers, we aim to decrease the share of fossil fuels in energy consumption. The fabrication technology of this product is another ‘green’ aspect. The conventional silicon refining reactors are costly and sawing ingots to wafers wastes about half the material. While the silicon dust can be recycled, the energy used to form that portion of the ingot is lost. The alternative semiconductor materials contain toxic elements and are not suitable for a wide range of uses. The Why Our mission is to commercialize silicon thread solar cells integrated in variety of products

The Pitch 21RISK is a data-centric SaaS that aims to enhance the Risk Management process at production facilities. Our vision is to use fact-based decision making, in order to provide an overview of your risk portfolio. We offer effective communication and superior documentation, seeking to set a new standard of information delivery in the Risk Management industry. The What We want to ensure less fire accidents The How We are a SaaS based Risk Management system, that provides enhanced overview and dynamic risk tracking for production facilities. Our vision is to bring fact-based decision making into the Risk Management process through our cloud based SaaS system. 21RISK brings a data driven approach to the field of Risk Management, enabling your company to go from feelings to facts when assessing your risk portfolio. The only sustainable way to reduce costs related to risk and claims, is to perform risk reducing tasks in a structured way. Our Task Manager allows this to happen in real-time, giving all stakeholders an always updated overview of the risk portfolio. Our management app is built on the base of an AI network that helps the user to file and review risk more efficiently. This provides you with daily updates about your risk portfolio, so you can feel safe and in charge of managing your risks. The Why Our core mission is to prevent fires in factories. We seek to inform through data in order to create better decision making

The Pitch Lapee is the world’s first transportable female urinal. The absence of female urinals has a considerable impact on gender equality. This is especially evident during outdoor events. While men normally have many different options to urinate, women only have two both of which are unpleasant. They can either queue for a long time to use a conventional unisex toilet or they can choose to squat in the gutter. Lapee provides an opportunity for girls and women to urinate quickly, safely and hygienicly. The What We want to solve a gender inequality The How Our hope is that the product will help equalise hygienic routines in precarious housing situations like refugee camps. In addition, it has environmental benefits as it is waterless, made from recyclable material and has been designed to optimize transportation, reducing carbon emission. The Why Lapee provides an opportunity for girls and women to urinate quickly, safely and hygienically.

The Pitch Envirate is a mobile application for assessing the state of the environment wherever you go. The application enables people to evaluate easily their surrounding environment in the same way as, for example, hotels are evaluated by customers. The What The world is facing huge environmental challenges. We need new solutions. The How We are driven by two key mission statements: "Humanity making peace with the Mother Earth" and "Valuing the environment". Our aim is to change people’s relation to their environment and produce global environmental big data on how people perceive their environment anywhere they go. Our motivation lies in Planetary Change for a better environment, and people's improved Awareness. The Why We are used to rate hotels, food, travel and so forth; why not do the same for the environment?

The Pitch REstart is the world's first local crowdfunding platform specifically for refugees to (re)start their companies. Whether it's €5 or €5.000, you support a local entrepreneur in gaining financial independence, while reducing the welfare budget, generating tax revenue, stimulating your local economy, and forming cross-culture alliances. The What Empowering refugee entrepreneurs with the capital they need to (re)start their companies The How Our primary mission is to empower refugee entrepreneurs with the capital they need to (re)start their companies. We can't do this without also empower private individuals everywhere with the potential to support refugee entrepreneurs. Thereby, we can all contribute to a thriving small business culture within our own communities. We are motivated by all of the people seeking a meaningful way to support refugees and the abundance of resources around us. The Why While many talk about the crisis, we want to focus on the solution. We have the resources we need, but until now there has been no sustainable way to tackle this challenge.

The Pitch B'ZEOS is developing a new organic and compostable material for replacing single-use plastic in food service industry. Our first product ZEOStraw will be the most sustainable single-use drinking straw commercialized on the Norwegian and European market. With ZEOStraw we aim to get one step closer to minimize our plastic usage. The What To replace plastic by edible alternatives The How We believe there is a cool and sustainable alternative to plastic straws! We believe in eco-innovation and we are working on an edible solution. Our product, ZEOS, stand for Zero waste, Edible, Organic and Sugar-free. It's all natural additives. We are a team of 8 people with complementary backgrounds. One engineer in environment, one research scientist, one chemist, one graphic designer, one supply chain analyst, one quality engineer advisor, one PR and marketing advisor and one CFO advisor. Each of us are concerned by environmental issues and wanted to contribute to making a change. We have joined this project because we are all fed up with: - Contamination of world's drinking water with plastic fibres - Seeing marine animals dying because of our plastic trash - The increase of plastic packaging around fresh aliments - Increase in plastic debris along the coast - Both burning plastic and sending plastic to landfills - Finding plastic while making with our kids sand castles - Contamination with the chemicals in plastic. These chemicals are said to cause obesity, on-set puberty, and even cancer. - Direct contamination of our kids by chewing various objects in plastic. - Being exposed to plastic every single day and not having the chance to choose an alternative We, at B’ZEOS and as consumers, believe in a sustainable alternative to current plastic and we have been working on the elaboration of a sustainable alternative without forcing the consumer to change dramatically his habits. The Why Over 500,000,000 plastic straws produced worldwide each day... Let's replace plastic naturally!

The Pitch We are an independent digital B2B-marketplace for surplus food and beverages. Our mission is to reduce unnecessary food waste by making surplus food accessible on the market in a cost-effective way and by simplifying the sale and donation process for both parties involved in a deal. All looped food is great food! The What To change the way surplus food is traded and treated The How Foodloopz wants to help companies in a variety of ways to manage surplus, food and challenges around these issues. Our core business is to help businesses easily, safely and quickly find new business contacts at every opportunity, where good food is likely to be good business. We do this by offering companies to advertise their surplus through us for sale or donation. We will help you find the perfect contact for each party on your own terms. There may be lots of pallets, goods with short dates left, broken packaging or, for example, fruit and vegetables that do not meet the quality requirements for established channels. At the same time, we see it as our core mission to help and challenge companies to think of new paths around the surplus and only you tell us what you want to help with and we will solve it. Our revenue model is based on providing a simple, secure, and fast ad-service for companies that want to buy or sell primarily food and drink with short best dates, bad quality, broken packaging, cutlery or stocks, and at the same time want to get a bang on the stores. The Why All good food deserves a second chance, and we believe that together we can streamline the utilization of the surplus as the resource it is.

The Pitch A food rescuing service that gives amazing deals - and a chance to 'ResQ' top-quality restaurant meals that would otherwise go to waste. The What Do Good, Rescue Food The How We are a young, fast-growing company developing the ResQ service, which allows consumers to "rescue" valuable food at risk of going to waste, from e.g. restaurants, bakeries, cafes and hotels. The service was launched publicly in Finland during the first months of 2016 and has since expanded rapidly, both locally and to new cities and countries. We are currently in 5 countries globally, and over 1000 provider partners and over 150 000 registered users have joined our club. We have already helped rescue over 250 000 portions from going to waste globally. The ResQ service reduces food waste by eliminating serving surpluses in restaurants and other food service providers. It gives these providers almost free extra revenue and lots of positive visibility. Consumers get affordable quality food easily. The Why Food waste is a massive problem as 10% of restaurant food is thrown away.

The Pitch We live in the digital world of smart phones that Grandmothers have access to, but don't understand or use to their benefit. Many Grandmothers don't know what an app is. They don't know how to engage with it. The KAMA app was made for Grandmothers and they will intuitively understand it. And they will feel less lonely with it. KAMA makes your family grow closer together. The What he love for your family is always there for you. Connect with it! The How At the heart of KAMA is a grandmother-friendly app. It is based on algorithms that suggest how families can communicate to preserve what they have, remember the past and prepare for the future. As copywriters would say: technology of tomorrow for stories of yesterday. What remains after us? What is our legacy? Who will remember us in 100 years? How did our voice sound? What did we love? What do we want to be remembered for? With KAMA these memories are preserved. As photos, videos and voice recordings. This way, we will enrich the lives of our future generations. The KAMA - App encourages conversations and creates memories that will enrich your life. With photos, videos and a user-friendly interface. The confidence and warmth of the past will come back and your family memories will blossom. The Why We believe that family is the most important thing in life. The less we see each other and hear from each other, the more we are missing out. Such as the love of your grandmother.

The Pitch SaltX Technology® stores energy in salt crystals and converts it to heating and cooling, reducing energy consumption and costs by 1/3. Think of it as a battery, but storing thermal energy rather than electricity The What Enabling a carbon emission free future The How SaltX has invented a patented technology to store energy with salt. When SaltX is implemented it enables a significant higher energy efficiency to end customers. The material and science can be applied in many different applications. Today, SaltX's technology collaborate with partners in the Solar, Heat-pump and Heavy-duty Vehicle market to create sustainable and resource efficient products. Our newest application -EnerStore- is designed to store large amounts of energy. Renewable energy is stored in the SaltX material and can be released when needed. The size of the application can be adjustable from family home size to large energy plant size. Think of it as a battery, but storing thermal energy in a sustainable way with small energy losses to a low cost. SaltX Technology’s technology addresses the global climate threat. When fully implemented SaltX could in a large scale reduce global carbon dioxide emissions. The technique itself is environmentally friendly and does not require any toxic substances. The Why SaltX Technology’s vision is to be the “Intel inside” in sustainable heating, cooling and energy storage products.

The Pitch Labtrino’s vision is to pave the way for a more sustainable planet, for us and for future generations. And in doing so, we hope that it will come natural for everyone to consider their own imprint on the planet and collectively help to minimize it. Labtrino was founded in 2017 by a group of entrepreneurs and engineers who wanted to prove that sustainable initiatives can be made obvious given the right knowledge and technology. Our team consists of highly driven engineers that cover a wide range of technological domains. The What Raising water consumption awareness through automated measurement systems. The How We focus on developing smart solutions in the form of embedded mechatronic systems, utilizing cloud services that communicate between web interfaces and smartphones and to inform customers about their water consumptions on a minute basis. Ignorance may be bliss, but too often unnoticed at the cost of others. We therefore aim to close the gap between our collective behaviour in how we consume nature’s resources and our understanding of its implications and consequences. The Why There is a saying: “What you don’t know won’t hurt you”. But once we know, we intrinsically strive to ease the pain. So let it known, so we together can make this world a better place for the next generation.

The Pitch Nordic Mapping Technologies has developed a versatile digital solution designed to accurately map and automatically generate addresses to rural and semi-rural households all over the globe. The system is designed to facilitate the capturing of key data about these households, thus generating a user database that can be accessed by providers of essential services. The flexible interface of the solution allows us to adapt the application to each type of user, providing them with the information that they need and nothing else. Benefits include having a physical address is a requirement for accessing so many of the services that many take for granted. By literally putting people on the map we make them easier to find when they need emergency assistance, they are allowed to register to vote for national elections, and are able to participate in the economy for example by being able to apply for credit. This opens up new socio-economic and democratic benefits and opportunities for people. The What Connecting people The How We aim to map and provide physical addresses to households, clinics and other public buildings in rural areas of developing countries. Having an address will enable rural households and communities to access emergency service, post and most importantly receive essential government infrastructural benefits like water, electricity and toilets efficiently, other community oriented institutions like schools, kindergartens and clinics will be enabled to be exposed to international donors. People who do not have a physical address lack access to essential services such as rapid emergency response to policing and medical needs, receiving post, applying for credit and registering to vote. The Why Nordic Mapping Technologies opens up new socio-economic and democratic benefits and opportunities for people.

The Pitch Unumed is a fully integrated Hospital Management Information System for the 21st century providing the best health software system to African, Middle Eastern and Asian health care facilities. To accomplish this mission we have designed and developed a unique hospital management system for all levels of health facilities. The system is user-friendly, affordable and integrated, and provides real-time information on facility performance. The What Redefine IT for health facilities The How Three billion people across the world are being treated at health facilities not operating at their full potential. The reason: they don’t have access to professional software. At Unumed, our mission is to improve the lives of the patients at these facilities by enhancing the quality of care that healthcare professionals are able to deliver. To accomplish this mission, we have developed a fully integrated hospital management information system (HMIS) for all types of health facilities from super hospitals to the smallest rural clinics. Who use our system? Well, doctors input clinical notes, nurses register triage information, accountants make insurance claim reports, cashiers prepare bills, pharmacists keep track of inventory, front-desk receptionists register and direct patients to queues, lab technicians receive lab requests and managers access dashboards that stream real-time information on financial, operational and clinical performance. At Unumed, we believe this is a meaningful and effective way of supporting professional healthcare delivery. If you feel the same and would like to know more about how it works, please get in touch. The Why Unumed has a simple mission: Provide the best health software system to African, Middle Eastern and Asian health care facilities.

The Pitch Duara is an online travel service that gives independent travellers the chance to experience everyday life in rural, low-income villages in Africa, Asia and Latin America – even on short holidays. Travellers stay in a local homes or guest houses, eat and cook with their hosts and join the daily activities in the village. Host families, and especially women in the families, get extra income and a way to employ themselves. The What Raising income levels in rural villages The How We advocate living with locals in a mutually beneficial fashion. One that not only enriches your travel experiences but directly and responsibly benefits and empowers the local communities within which you’re invited. Staying with farmers, following host families to work, dining together around the table, getting a glimpse into their world and leaving a piece of yourself behind as a way of fostering cultural understanding. Our mission is to raise the income levels in rural, low-income villages by offering the local community new employment opportunities (mainly outside harvesting season). While gaining extra income the villagers get a chance to share their culture - which often makes them want to improve the living conditions in their village. Our business model entails that the payment from travellers is divided: The family hosting the travellers receives 40% of the payment, the local Duara contact receives 10% of the payment, 10% goes to a carefully elected savings group in the neighborhood to benefit the whole community, and lastly, Duara Travels receives 30% of the payment to help maintain and develop the service. The remaining 10% goes to international money transfer costs, caused by paying each party separately. The Why When we travel we want to meet local people and experience real life. We dream about being treated as friends, not as guests.

The Pitch CodersTrust is a financial firm that provides education and micro loans to students in emerging countries. The What Replacing a 100-years old workforce model The How Learn more, earn more! CodersTrust is providing education and micro loans to students in emerging countries, so they can improve their coding skills and earn more money on freelance markets. Our business idea is essentially very simple: one of the biggest barriers to technology-based economic development in developing countries is the relatively high cost of - generally poor quality - of appropriate education and particularly access for "base of the pyramid" to education and jobs within the tech-based economy. Be part of our mission and become our backer, advisor or mentor - We provide access to online tech based education, and you can empower young talented individuals, give them the tools to change their lives and prospects for the future! The Why The educational system as we know it needs to go through some major changes. Unfortunately, not much has really changed about school as a whole since back the 18th century.

The Pitch Vipicash is more than a fintech company. We’re on a mission to change the way money is being sent abroad. We understand the frustrations that come with sending money back home and we’re here to do something about it. Whether you want to pay for loved ones or invest in a business or property, you shouldn’t have to guess how your money is spent. The What Empowering women, and making sure remittance and donations are able to be tracked and spent in the right way. The How VipiCash is a decentralized remittance and aid transfer platform built on the ethereum blockchain. Empowering women, and making sure remittance and donations are able to be tracked and spent in the right way. The Why Vipicash let’s you to lock your money into the goods and services you choose so your family get the support they need and your projects can really take off.

The Pitch tiimo is an app for smartwatches and smartphones, specifically designed to help children with ADHD, Autism and Brain damage in their everyday lives. tiimo guides and supports the child throughout their day. As an interactive little friend, tiimo will consistently give helpful advice to the child and provide a clear overview of what he or she has to do. The What Empowering children with extra needs The How tiimo is working to improve the lives of children with need for extra structure and independence in everyday life, including children with ADHD, autism and light brain damage. We do that by using strategies and tools recommended for children with special needs - like structure, focus, time management and pictograms - and combine them in one digital solution. Our app is specially designed for smartwatches and works as an interactive friend on the arm that guides and supports the child throughout the day. Through a visual calendar with icons, small vibrations and time management, we provide the structure, overview and independance the child needs. The Why The purpose of tiimo is to give children peace of mind and a robustness to succeed in life.

The Pitch Wattero offers solar energy projects as an investment opportunity for Norwegians. We connect Norwegians who want to make ethical investments with profitable solar projects that need funding. We find the projects through our local partner and market them to the Norwegian market. The What Providing clean energy all over the world The How Our vision is to offer access to clean energy to people all over the world. With the help of our local partners, we look for areas without access to grid electricity and develop off grid solar energy projects. We are social entrepreneurs that are motivated to contribute towards the 2030 agenda about developing technologies that can empower people and are eco-friendly at the same time. We believe that it is possible to invest in an ethical way that we can allow others to have access to clean and renewable energy and improve people's lifes. Currently we are working in Tripoko, a small village located in the south-west of the Ivory Coast. We chose to launch the first project in Ivory Coast as it is a country with huge potential for introducing solar energy as an alternative energy source. Although solar power already exists in the country, it is still many people who need access to energy. The Why We are motivated by the possibility of providing clean energy to people who need it, enabling development, empowerment and sustainability.

The Pitch Nextmile is a service and community for senior employees and retirees for long and healthy life. Work is crucial part for well being, we have developed a solution for smooth retiring from working life and enabling flexible ways to work during retirement. The What Western societies are struggling with costly age structure. In European Union almost 70 million people are reaching retirement age within next decade. Pension costs are rising millions and millions every year. We enable retired citizens to be active and meaningful part of society by enabling flexible working. The How We want nobody to retire alone. We have noticed that the overall attitude toward work is changing. We also look at our own work history in a new way. We strive to provide tools and guidance so that the new phase of your working life will start naturally and at the pace you like. We are piloting a web service for motivated senior experts to introduce their professional experience and know-how to potential employers to hire. The Why Retirement doesn't mean the end of dreaming, vice versa, we need to pursue our dreams as long as we live. And that keeps us living and healthy. Senior citizens can be the real force of change in this time we live. We want to bring them up from forgetfulness back to bright lights and driving forces of societies!

The Pitch VenomAid present a cheap, easy-to-use, point-of-care testing device for rapid diagnosis of snakebite victims. We want to improve the treatment of snakebite victims globally by making rapid diagnosis of snakebite victims possible in the most affected countries in the world. The What Aiding snake bite victims The How Each year more than five million people are bitten by venomous snakes. Snakebite envenoming calls for rapid diagnosis and correct treatment to avoid death and disability. VenomAid presents a solution to this problem: A cheap, easy-to-use, point-of-care device that provides a reliable diagnostic result within minutes. We provide a fast and reliable diagnostic tool, ensuring that the required treatment can start at once. This will minimize both fatalities and permanent sequlae that victims suffer from, especially in the poor rural parts of the world. VenomAid provides a reliable diagnostic result within minutes of loading blood directly from the site of the bite (or from a standard blood sample) onto the device. If snake venom is present in the blood from the victim, a color change will appear on a test line, detectable by the naked eye. This quick determination of which snake is responsible allows for early and correct treatment, sparing both limbs and lives of many. The Why Our mission is to better the lives/conditions for patients suffering from snakebite and the treating medical personnel.

The Pitch We provide an affordable high-quality facility service for businesses, by employing well trained, motivated and friendly refugees. While simultaneously ensuring good working conditions and fair living wages for refugees in Denmark. The What Creating jobs for refugees The How YES CPH CO. is an impact startup that works towards alleviating some key social issues in Denmark. We work primarily towards challenging the unacceptable working conditions for migrants and refugees in the unskilled labor market in Denmark. Through our work as a service company, we provide an affordable high-quality facility service for businesses, by employing well trained, motivated and friendly refugees. Everyone should have the opportunity to prove themselves. We at YES give refugees in Denmark that opportunity. We need you to be part of the mission BTW, YES means' Young, Excellent & Social ' The Why We enable a better life quality and independence for refugees outside of Danish labor force.

The Pitch Mimbly is a Gothenburg-based startup that aims to provide accessible water recycling by developing products that break down the biggest impediment to recycling - simplicity. Our journey is just beginning. We believe in creating innovative solutions that directly tackle water scarcity. The What Changing the way water is consumed today The How We develop innovative products for the household that directly tackle water scarcity. Household water consumption has a tremendous effect on the world's overall freshwater resources. In the western world, each household consumes 950 litres of water per day. Accounting for 10% of the total freshwater resources, which account for 978 trillion litres of water per year. Everything started by searching for an answer to a critical question: "Do we really need potable drinking water in our washing machines?" The Mimbox directly tackles that question, providing an interesting outlook for the use of greywater in the home. The Why We believe in tackling water scarcity by acting at the source of water consumption.
OKO (Israel) is crop insurance designed for emerging markets, using new technologies in satellite imagery and weather forecasting to simplify and automate claim management.
Solar Freeze (Kenya) is pioneering mobile cold storage units powered by renewable energy for smallholder farmers, to help them reduce post-harvest loss in the developing world.

Leaf is a global, virtual bank for vulnerable populations crossing borders.
They developed a blockchain-based money management solution for refugees and migrants to store, send, and exchange money globally without requiring a smartphone or internet.
Leaf stores and transports assets across borders from a mobile device—no smartphone required. Refugees and migrants can journey without cash, knowing accounts are safe and accessible globally. Leaf enables customers to digitally store savings, receive deposits from abroad, and manage money from a mobile device no matter where they go. Digitizing services drastically reduces exchange and transfer fees for customers.

Leaf Global Fintech's Story
Leaf’s CEO, Nat Robinson, spent nearly seven years starting and running a successful microfinance company in Kenya. He is passionate about using technology to provide financial services to the unbanked around the world. Leaf’s CTO, Tori Samples, has fifteen years of personal experience working with resettled refugees in addition to a professional career in technology. She is passionate about building solutions to help refugees connect with loved ones and create a community.

Platform that brings together those who need help with those who want to help. eSolidar is an innovative online platform for people to support the causes they really care about.

They are a dynamic team that is passionate about developing technology and creating social impact. Their focus is to harness these tools to create an online community that benefits charities around the world.

It is their goal at eSolidar to be the all-encompassing way for charities to fundraise online in a timely and cost-effective way, creating an online community that can help charities from the bottom up.

eSolidar brings a supportive community together in one convenient place. They are committed to transparency and the communities they serve.

eSolidar's Story
They intend to be the largest digital social community, a platform where projects can find help quickly and globally so that we can have a fairer world and where everyone has the same opportunities.

eSolidar team believes that technology is a fundamental means to support the fight against inequality and that is why every day they work to create tools that facilitate the connection of people who want to help, with those who need help.

Increasing the transparency of the application of the financial resources that are donated is also one of their priorities so that they can generate confidence in the process and increase the frequency and value of donations.
Grou is a platform that connects small producers and buyers, diminishing food waste and increasing income for farmers.

Vista Volcanes, S.A. develops and commercializes agricultural technology systems developed via extensive research, with the objective of promoting the transition from conventional agriculture to organic and protected agriculture.
Advanced BioControllers researches, develops, and sells environmentally-friendly biopesticides to control pests and increase agricultural productivity.
Apic.ai (Germany) uses honeybees as biosensors in the fight to protect biodiversity.
Solar Freeze (Kenya) is pioneering mobile cold storage units powered by renewable energy for smallholder farmers, to help them reduce post-harvest loss in the developing world.

Rolela is a virtual market place for expiring food items. Vendors like f. ex. supermarkets, shops, restaurants, farmers, etc. can offer their expiring food items via their website/app to end-users and other vendors applying a discount or offer these for free to charity users. Their service is free of charge for end-users and charity users, vendors pay a monthly subscription fee for our services.

Rolela's Story
Rolela was founded in 2017 by Jerry Schu and Peter Schalk! They both have over 10 years of experience in technical support for companies like IBM, HPE, and SAP. They have a passion for simple and easy-to-use IT solutions and have been since long intrigued by the question of food waste so they decided to create Rolela.
Kirón develops medical articles focused on improving the quality of life of its clients and social inclusion of people with disabilities.
Pegasi created 20/20, the first Latin American Electronic Health Record Platform (EHRP), optimizing the management of clinico-administrative information for over 16,000,000 patients in 5 years.

Estación Vital empowers populations to monitor their health by providing preventative evaluations through an integrated platform available in kiosks, and concurrently helps companies to communicate with their most relevant customers.
Freshwater Solutions seeks to improve the quality of life of people that do not have access to safe, good-quality water by producing and selling purified and sustainable water sourced from the air.
Flare (Kenya) offers software infrastructure and operational support for medical emergency response services in Sub-Saharan Africa.
mDoc (Nigeria) uses a digital platform and in-person hubs to support people living with chronic diseases.
Wondertree (Pakistan) accelerates cognitive and motor development in children with special needs through movement-based therapeutic and educational AR games.
ASHONPLAFA offers family planning, and sexual and reproductive health services and products.
Belize Family Life Association is a 21st century response to your family's sexual and reproductive health.
Broterra industrializes raw materials from overlooked sectors of society to create a range of healthy and organic foods.
Centro de Líder teaches pragmatic transformation based on mindfulness to leaders and organizations for greater performance, wellness and purpose.

Diagnochip is a Chilean startup company focused in the development of rapid antibiotic sensitivity kits to be used at the point of care and getting results faster than conventional antibiogram ( 8 hours versus 3 – to 4 days)

Diagnochip's Story
Diagnochip has developed and patented in Chile a medical device named Rapid Antibiotic Sensitivity Kit to be used in patients with urinary tract infections (UTI).
This is a common disease worldwide, affecting particularly women and elderly people, and to treat it correctly it is necessary to have an antibiogram.
In developing countries and rural zones, it is difficult to do an antibiogram, because labs and medical staff are not available 24/7 or simply medical service does not exist.

Develop Diverse is the world’s first software tool that automatically analyses stereotypic content for gender, age, and ethnicity in texts and proposes non-stereotypic alternatives.

Scientific studies have proven that the use of stereotypic language when writing job ads is common practice, and this has a psychological effect on potential applicants. Such language makes these job ads biased towards specific demographic groups, discouraging other groups from applying and this effect can reduce the applicant pool by as much as 50%.

Their solution, the DD-scan is an AI-based software tool that promotes inclusive writing which will enable you to reach a wider and more diverse talent pool. The DD-scan detects and color-highlights implicitly and explicitly stereotypic language in your texts and suggests neutral alternatives in real-time. This way, their customers have attracted 3x more qualified candidates regardless of gender, ethnicity, or age, and save time on recruitment.

Their vision is to empower companies to make diversity the new norm in every company.

Develop Diverse's Story
